description:
I would not dare trying their chiles rellenos--that's an haute cuisine delicacy, so I do not want to be disappointed. There is no such thing as authentic Mexican restaurants in the city of San Francisco. But as a typical San Francisco taqueria, this El Super Burrito is actually pretty good, much better than almost any taqueria in the Mission District. I just dare order safe dishes--dishes that, I know, won't disappoint me, such as broiled meat dishes, quesadillas, or tacos.

I just had the carne asada dish: the meat was cooked the right way, not dry at all, served with small size onions, guacamole, cream, lettuce, beans, and rice, all for just 12 USD, much better than any other deal offered by most other restaurants in the Polk Gulch area. The lettuce was very fresh, the beans were very well prepared and cooked, and the guacamole was freah, as well. The rice was OK. I enjoyed my meal very much, compared to anything I typically experience in the Mission.
author: Raymond F.

description:
$0.50 charge for debit/credit. Plenty of seats. Great menu selection.

Tacos are always a good idea when you're drunk. However, if a place has nacho fries, I just HAVE to get it, with carne asada of course. For $10 the portion wasn't as generous as I'd hoped, but then again... that's SF for you. At least it was good grub!
author: Cindy C.

description: Worst al Al Pastor super burrito I have ever eaten. Not only are they over priced, $9.39, but the burrito is very small and the meat was BURNT. I do not recommend this place.
author: Jaycee C.

description:
This place has microwaved nachos and the service is terrible. The cashier rolled her eyes at my girlfriend and I as we ordered. The food isn't good either. Chips are stale and food is bland. My "giant quesadilla" was the size of my hand, with dry meat and burnt tortilla. I would rather go to El Farolito or Taqueria Guadalajara for authentic Mexican food. This place is trash compared to those gems.

Side note: Their restrooms have stalls with no doors so you have to lock the entire bathroom to use the restroom in privacy
author: Oscar L.

description: Really good burritos, but really bad nachos. Pretty hit-or-miss, but the best taqueria in the neighborhood
author: Eric L.

description: Wanted a snack after Opera. Got a shrimp burrito, split it in half, and shared it. It had beans and bbq sauce.
author: Denise C.

description: Service was quick and I love the pixelated soccer ball. They asked for customization and the prices we're really good. Lots of veg options!
author: Chris W.

description: The tacos were very disappointing. The meat tasted a bit strange and the tortilla was soggy. That being said, bumped it up a star because a friend enjoyed the burrito.
author: Michael S.

description:
I understand that they have to deal with a lot of stressful shenanigans, but the older dude running the joint is way out-of-line. Also, health score of 87/100 - which means "Several violations observed
May have high-risk violations." Diiiiiirrrrtttttaaay.
author: Tony D.

description:
My first time here I was incredibly happy, I got a super burrito with carnitas (fried shredded pork). But as I keep coming back, I notice the inconsistency in freshness of the pork. It can be dry or even old at times. That is so disappointing because I almost always get pork when I order Mexican food. I've tried it other ways, Chili Verde and Pastor but I seem to get the food that was made yesterday and being served today. 

I don't want to stop coming here so I will order chicken or steak next time. The salsa is so yummy. This place deserved another chance. :)
author: Kat D.

description:
3 stars if I am buzzed and get a California Burrito

This is my desperate Mexican destination. If I am craving a burrito but I am too lazy to walk somewhere better, this is where I go.

Burritos are meh. Lack flavor and guac is runny. Tacos are pretty boring. Its basic / generic taqueria food without the flavors of a La Taqueria, Pancho Villa, etc.

I would give 2 stars but the people are nice, its cheap and I still go here once a month.
author: Nick B.

description: I live 1 block away and always avoid this place. I love Mexican food. Super hungry right now.  This is the Carne Assad's Jumbo Burrito wet. Do you see any steak? I'm sure it will be many years until I am hungry enough to come here again.
author: James L.

description: Finding a Mexican place that serves more than just tacos or burritos is hard to find. Our expectations were low, and we were planning we asantly surprised.  Pork tamales were okay, enchiladas (beef) were good, rice and beans were good, even the watery avocado sauce was  surprisingly good. We'd probably eat here again if we found ourselves in this neighborhood and hungry for Mexican.
author: Monica F.

description: Best Mexican food on the Block! True authentic taste from Mexico. Very friendly employees. This is my go to spot hands down! Every type of Mexican food you can think of
author: Christian R.

description: Good carnitas tacos with lots of meat!! And cheap for SF and this area. Can't say its the best Mexican food ever but certainly worth a stop when I need a late night snack or just a late dinner in my way back from work.
author: G O.

description: I've been coming here for almost a decade. Their salsa rojo is the best salsa in SF. The green salsa is usually tops also. Their boiled chicken is very tasty, as is their shrimp burrito. However, many things leave a lot to be desired. Today's veggie burrito was more like a lettuce burrito - more than half of the filling was lettuce. Very disappointing. Still a good spot for chips, guacamole, and salsa, but not too many options for vegetarians.
author: Esembee B.

description: A good SF Burrito is found here. I get the al pastor super burrito with no onion and add salsa picosa. Today I picked up ten burritos for my crew that's working in North Beach and is tired of pizza. I didn't have to go farther into the Mission to get an awesome burrito and for that I am grateful.
author: Carlos F.

description:
Super quick and friendly service, but the Carne asada was a bit bland.
I got the Carne asada super burrito and the tortilla wasn't toasted like most taqueria's do, and guacamole was very watery, but the rice and beans in it were pretty good.
Great service, average Mexican fare.
author: Steve E.

description: My co worker brought me here and as soon as i step inside to get in line there was a ROACH walking in line with me!!!!! Terrible first experience. I hipe the food is good and healthy for everyone thats eating it!!!! Then i decide to get something to drink and my co worker wanted a 99 cents Arizona and the lady said it is 2.50$  this place has no customer service & its dirty and nasty and filled with ROACHES !!!$
author: Patricia C.

description:
This spot is legit when you're wandering around SF's cold, rainy streets after a night of drinking and you just want to eat SOMETHING. Big restaurant with a nice selection, and portions are generous. Got a vegetarian burrito (rice, beans, cheese, sour cream, pico de gallo, lettuce) for $5.95 and it was huge and delicious -- surprisingly more than I would expect for a veggie burrito.

Service is super fast - my burrito was done before I could sit down at a table to wait for it. It was so huge, I saved half for my breakfast the next morning, and it was still delicious!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
If you are a visitor please read this!!!!!

This is not what good Mexican west coast taste like. Please try one of the many 3.5 stars and above places in SF!
author: Keith B.

description: Best al pastor in the city! Their ceviche is hella good too. It's my favorite taqueria in SF
author: Yolanda D.

description:
I moved to SF about five years ago and have lived a block off of Polk and California since that time.  I moved here for work and early on in my time here I was walking home after a long day.  Those were stressful times and I was craving a solid dinner of comforting Mexican food.  That was my first stop.  I came in, ordered, sat and ate complimentary chips and salsa and went home in retreat.  It was one of the most comforting meals of my life.  The Burrito was big, the salsa was zesty.  I went to bed with a full stomach and my stress was gone.  Man, this place is long overdue for a review from old Adam S.  And, it's pretty deserving of a good review to begin with.  El Super Burrito is a terrific place in the Polk Gulch neighborhood with reliably filling and tasty Mexican food.  I have yet to be disappointed.

In my book, this place sort of hits my formula for a good Mexican place.  Walk in, counter-ordering.  Good range of menu items with a heavy emphasis on the basics (Tacos, Burritos, Nachos).  Good range of meats to choose from, which are all good quality.  I am a big fan of the Carnitas, the El Pastor and the Chorizo.  There is a cooler full of bottled beer.  And, there is the salsa bar with complimentary chips and salsa - help yourself, within reason.  You can dine in and they'll bring your order to the table, or you can take it out.  It's not a long wait even though everything is cooked to order.  Generous portions.  Reasonable prices.  The guy who is normally on the grill seems to slave away and I think he does a great job - I don't know for sure, but I get the sense that this is a family run place.  It is not pretentious, nor overly divey, and it feels totally authentic while still being in the hustle and bustle of Polk Gulch.  ... and, three blocks from my Fortress of Solitude.  

Traditional Mission-style Burrito.  Go with the Jumbo (lettuce, tomato, rice, beans, cheese, sour cream and guacamole) with your choice of meat.  I like Carnitas.  Al Pastor is good an greasy and the grease is delicious.  Chorizo is spicy!  The Chile Verde is nice and rich.  It's all pretty good.  Leave it half wrapped in the foil and add their salsa.  It's a meal, and the ingredients are balanced right.  I've had the nachos a number of times, and you get a big portion with generous amounts of Pico de Gallo, Sour Cream and Guacamole.  I like them with the Chorizo.  The tacos are pretty good but are not a stand out for this place.  Solid Taco Salad.  And, I'll be honest, there are a lot of other items that are more like entrees and I would imagine that they are pretty good.  Also, the chips and salsa are great and it's nice to grab a little starter and sip on a beer while waiting for take-out.  

However many times it appears I've checked in, the number is actually about 25 higher since this predates my Yelping.  It may be more than that.  I really like this place and I will go back.  I wish that it was open longer hours.  I'd love to grad a breakfast burrito on a work day.  And, for what it's worth, they could score some big business if they stayed open late-night in this neck of the woods.  I get the sense that they are a business that stays true to their vision.  Simple, honest Mexican food done well.
author: Adam S.

description: I really wanted to give this place a better rating since my first few times eating there was a pleasant experience, but I had a horrible case of food poisoning from the last time I ate there.  My boyfriend has a stomach of steel and even got a stomach ache.
author: Crystal B.

description: I bought a burrito for $9, they gave me a quesadilla (worth $3) and then swore they gave me a burrito and that the quesadilla in my hand wasn't for me. How do you fight that? I ate the $6 quesadilla in anger.
author: Jenna B.

description: I had the chicken super burrito. It was delicious. I will definitely come back here! It was made fresh and served quickly.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Al pastor tacos
Pretty good! Al pastor was done well and was pretty juicy.

Free chips and salsa
Both were mediocre.

Horchata
Good, wasn't the soda machine kind.

Heard the California burritos were also pretty good.
author: Alice T.

description:
Went to La Taqueria over the weekend and realized what made their burritos "best in the country"... they grill them after they assemble them. So I came to my usual burrito spot during my weekday grind and ordered my usual: carnitas super burrito. But this time I had them grill it after it was made... World of a difference!!!!! 

It added just the perfect amount of crunch on the tortilla and came out piping hot! In fact I think it even help keep all the juices in and not make it as messy as before. 

Hallelujah!!! I've seen the light! And it's all about the grilled outer layer!!!!
author: Stephen Y.

description: Best quesadillas in town!!! Locally owned business that's been around for years. Super friendly staff are always polite and accommodating. Great spot to hit after going to the local bars.
author: Dasha S.

description:
El suuuuuuuuuuuuuper burritoooooooooooo!

Big juicy burritos. No doubt about that. However, I don't think I'd ever be saying this, but... where's the health department when you need it?
author: Nick K.

description: El Super Burrito is fairly priced, casual, consistent, and just all around good. On top of that, I'd wager they make as good of a taco al pastor as you can find in the city. Better than anything I've found in the Mission. And, being as quality of al pastor is my primary criteria for a Mexican joint, El Super Burrito holds a special place in my heart.
author: Austin M.

description: When you're hungry, and it's getting late, there's no better pit stop.  Grab a California burrito, it hits the spot!
author: Brandi W.

description: Burrito was cold cheese wasn't even melted. Cashier told me they had black beans then burrito didn't have any. Cashier was super rude. They offered to refund my money but I had to give burrito back.
author: Jessica G.

description:
Super burrito is super.. 

Salsa are very good.

Caritas is one of my favorites.. 

Portions are healthy as one would expect.

They have all the major comfort foods and do them well.

Prices are in the standard range.
author: Tammy P.

description:
I came here during Santacon to get something delicious to eat after a crowded walk along Polk Street. It was super crowded during the day, and I was really craving something fast and cheap, and El Super Burrito was a great choice!

I loved how quick the service was, even though the environment was crazy due to the day. The servers were fast, efficient, and helpful.

I ordered the chicken quesadilla, and given the price (~$5) and the wait time, I was really satisfied with my experience. The quesadilla itself was jam packed with a really delicious and flavorful grilled chicken - I wish there were more cheese in the quesadilla itself to bind it together more since the quesadilla was kind of falling apart as I was eating it. Nonetheless, it was a really good five dollar quesadilla - super filling too.

One of my favorite parts of El Super Burrito were the free chips! The chips themselves were super crispy, and with a spritz of lime and some salt on them, they were fantastic! There is also a selection of salsa as well, making for the perfect accompanying take-out appetizer.

I'll definitely come back here if I want a quick and filling meal on Polk. Really great!
author: Sheila D.

description: My friend brought me here for lunch saying this was a good spot he used to eat at when he worked down in the tenderloin. I look around and notice it's dirty and they're half full with customers. He orders a burrito and I ordered two grilled chicken tacos. I did a check-in on Yelp and after it posted it gave me an alert stating this business was just recently inspected and scored BELOW 5% of other local restaurants or something like that. I didn't want to cause a scene so I took my food and threw it away. He did the same with his burrito. Just knowing this place is dirty & nasty I could dare eat their food. I'm wondering why are they still open if they scored so horribly?
author: Itika D.

description: This is the first time I write a review on Yelp but I had to because I was so pleasantly surprised by this place. My boyfriend and I split a super el pastor burrito and it was bomb af. Super juicy, the meat was slightly crispy and it wasn't overly salted like many other Mexican restaurants are. I'm Mexican and I have to say this is probably the best pastor I've had in SF. Oh and get the horchata. It's bomb af also.
author: Alex C.

description: This place is always awesome. Nearly always open and always good. It's always busy too. Their low ratings are just foolish haha. I've lived here for seven years and this one of the best places to get an amazing burriot or pezole (: especially if you're a southern California transplant like myself haha! It's seriously good food and affordable unlike nearly everything else in this city.
author: Corryn N.

description:
Ok for a quick cheap bite if walking by.  I don't think I would ever call it a destination restaurant!

Smells of ammonia since the busboy just mopped the floor.  Place could use a good cleaning.
author: Joanna S.

description:
In general, I've avoided El Super Burrito because it's not the brightest, newest, or cleanest-looking of places but that has never stopped me before. On a friend's comment that their super nachos aren't bad at all, I stopped by for an in-between snack. 

I had the Tostada De Cevice and I must admit it wasn't that bad considering how seafood in a place as mentioned could've been a bad idea. I liked the brightness of the citrus and the diced up little bits of mystery seafood was actually decently fresh. Nice chunks of avocado to round everything put. 

It might not be much to look at but El Super Burrito is quick and cheap. Now that I've finally gone it, I won't be opposed to a return visit.
author: Jon L.

description: Pretty expensive place for the food quality and cleanliness of the place. A dinner for two will cost you almost $40, add a few extra bucks and go to a nicer and better location. In short this place is a rip off. Food is ok but extremely overpriced and dirty.
author: Ana V.

description: Beef super burrito is amazing. Even just a simple cheese quesadilla hit the spot. Super packed burrito and tasted very fresh.
author: Kerry G.

description: The Tacos were tasty, there was a nice variety on the menu, the salsas in the salsa bar were very flavorful (the habanero salsa was amazing) and the staff was super kind and knew the menu well. I also appreciate the authenticity of the place. It reminded me of a place I use to eat at in Mexico.
author: Tawny D.

description:
Super tasty giant burritos! I got the jumbo which adds lettuce to the typical burrito - ended up with just wilted lettuce. But the burrito was delicious. I read a review saying the green sauce was too spicy, and I tasted no spice to it. I got my burrito wet with both green and red sauce -
Highly recommend, but green wins in my book. However, the habanero salsa at the tortilla chip bar put my mouth on fire! I barely put a dent in the giant burrito though
author: Diana E.

description:
Oh man, no menudo? it's Saturday morning and NO MENUDO! What the hey. That just ain't right especially when I got into a menudo mood. I've driven to Oakland to get good menudo, so I was happy I only had to take the 19 to find it. But they were out, and I'll be damned if I have to take another bus to the Mission to get it. That's how I ended up getting an $8.50 bowl of Caldo de Res, and it just wasn't the same. Sure, there were big chunks of beef shank that have obviously been sitting in a stock pot for quite some time. Carrots and big hunks of potato they didn't bother to make bite-size. They looked like they used zucchini and cabbage rather than chayote. There was plenty of cilantro and chopped onion (photo: http://bit.ly/1diSo3A).

But when you're in the mood for menudo, it doesn't quite cut it, at least until I cut one, you should pardon the expression. I needed something to offset my disappointment, so I ordered a $2.50 Super Taco as a chaser. That was a huge mound of shredded lettuce on top of the grilled beef strips with a lonely half-tomato slice on top (photo: http://bit.ly/1gshH1N). It was nearly impossible to pick up, so I started grazing on it like I was a cow. As tacos go, it was pretty decent but nothing that would warrant a special trip on the 19 dodging the meth addicts. This wallet-friendly Polk Gulch taqueria has been around a long time and will probably outlast me. But c'mon, surely there must be some tendon and a little tripe back there, por favor.

FOOD - 3 stars...the beef soup will have to do as a middling substitute for menudo
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...a lot of formica in here and little else
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...not very regretful for the lack of menudo
TOTAL - 3 stars...not that super at El Super
author: Ed U.

description:
The Nachos were Tasty. The meat just the right amount of tender and savory. They chips crispy and fresh. Everything was fresh which is always great. Sadly the amount was not so Super. I saw my food arrive almost as regular.... so order extra???
Horchata was great as well. Not too sweet at all. They serve the drinks behind their counter so don't count on refilling yourself.
author: Tori A.

description: Service sucks. Their menu prices are different than when they ring you up. Not going back
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description: Surprised! I had a two-taco platter with cabeza and al pastor, and they were both great.  The al pastor was especially good.  They ask if you want cilantro with the salsa on the tacos, and there's also a self-service salsa and tortilla chip bar.
author: Dan C.

description:
I have been here twice so far for lunch and both times the cashier has told me my total was 6 something. When he gave me the receipt to sign, the total was 7 something. I don't know whether there was a credit card fee or what, but the prices are deceiving and inaccurate. The cashier was also eyeing my receipt as I was signing, which made me feel pressured to leave a bigger tip. 

This place is cheaper than Panchos near by but I wouldn't return to either of these two eateries. 
Food is average. I ordered a vegetarian burrito today and I believe I was missing some ingredients and ate mostly the tortilla. 
Salsa bar is decent but the mild was a lot more spicer than I expected. 
Water dispenser water... was warm. It doesn't help to drink warm water while eating spicy foods either..
author: Mei Z.

description:
Halloween 2016. Maybe I was drunk, or maybe I know what's good Mexican food since I am 100% latina. Their Carnitas burrito was bomb. It is so easy for restaurants to over do it with the salt, but this place was perfect. Great flavor, and it was even nice and crispy. Honestly, I can never finish more than half the burrito, but towards the end of the night I told my boyfriend I could go for another, and I can be full af and not care. It was that good, and, get this, I ordered a regular burrito. WOAH. 

*bathrooms were sketchy, to be honest. They definitely reminded me of Mexico.
Unisex, no bathroom stalls, not much privacy- lol*
author: Jennifer Z.

description: The salsa bar was basic but nice. The burrito was very tasty. The service was sweet. I like this place and will come back. Most tables were taken by appeared to be locals and workers. It has a good vibe.
author: Jen B.

description: I have been craving a burrito for the longest.  So when i got off school i went straight to El super Burrito around 7:30pm and ordered a carne asada burrito to go. Well atleast that's what i recall ordering. Well when i got home i was super excited looking forward to all the wonderful favors. Well due to my surprise once i took a bite of it i realized it wasnt carne asada.  It turned out to be a leftover burrito. Did they accidently throw away all the good part of the meat and put in the ugly gooey rubberish nerves instead. I dont know. But it made me want to throw up.  this use to be my go to taqueria. But i can see things have  obviously changed. I will definitely give this place another chance hoping yesterday's incident was an accident....
author: Silvia C.

description: My husband loves their tacos and this is what he always gets. I ordered a spicy shrimp platter and everything on the plate - shrimp, beans, rice, and guacamole tasted super delicious. Shrimp had just the right amount of spice and tenderness.  Honestly, I didn't expect such great food from a hole in the wall. This is my now go-to neighborhood spot for the Mexican food.
author: EG P.

description: El Súper Burrito makes the best California burritos. I also enjoy the Grande quesadilla. The ceviche is good but i wish it was more like a dip. They have a friendly staff that hablar español. Clean and comes with a bag of hips and salsa. Can't beat it!!!
author: Trent W.

description: ***WARNING*** The low food safety score popup you see on Yelp of this restaurant is true.  Had 4 different pork tacos and one of them gave me severe food poisoning!!
author: Dav K.

description:
Worst burrito I've had in the city. 

Dry meat,  contents layered awkwardly, okay-but-not-great tortilla. 50c surcharge for credit card purchases. Sole saving grace is late hours - grabbed a chicken burrito between bar hopping.
author: Vaibhav M.

description:
Decided to get 3 tacos (steak/carnitas/al pastor) 

All 3 meat lacked seasoning, quality felt mediocre at best, and were really dried out

It was great to see they have a open salsa and chip bar for their customers and thought the sauces weren't too shabby

Overall Thoughts

When searching for late night grub on Polk, I sure hope there is better than El Super Burrito
author: Eddie W.

description:
This place made both my sister and I sick.
We both had burritos, different proteins but same stomach ache for 2-3 days.
This was the second occasion I came here and same result. 
I should've learned my lesson the first time.
author: Mark ant d.

description:
I would have loved to give this Mexican fast food chain (they do have another location in Millbrae... wait... does that make it a chain?) a better rating but the food just wasn't great.

The staff and service - super friendly and fast. Location - great, located on Polk and Sutter. The restaurant - spacious enough with lots of seating. Prices - inexpensive.

The food - I had a quesadilla (cheese, without meat) that tasted blunt and boring, and two fish tacos that were small and flavorless, and topped with cheese (really?). Disappointing.

However, I appreciate the free salsa section (every Mexican eatery should have this!) and will give it another try next time. Twice's the charm!
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Listen guys its not fancy, they don't wait on your table, and your expected to clean your own table off.
But if you are a fan of carnitas (pulled pork) order that shit on everything here. I think it's baked, then fried and it will melt your face. And the habanero hot sauce will put some hair on your chest. 

-your welcome-
author: Timothy A.

description: Food was good prices fair but restaurant was dirty and stank! The couple I was with sat in a booth only to find it was soaked.  They weren't happy walking around with wet pants lol.
author: Brad S.

description: We were starving and came upon this place. A little rocky start but the burritos we ordered were great (the waitress didn't want us to use the bathroom until we ordered,  even though we told her we were eating there. One of us was in direct straights lol ) anyhow they have 3 kinds of salsa thin, thin and well ok I guess. Not impressed with chips or salsa. Our burritos were pork Verde and big and delicious. I would come back! Price was  $7.50,  not bad for San Francisco!
author: Kelly P.

description:
While many nights we may find our group wandering up and down Polk street on our bar migration, El Super Burrito has been there late at night (and for lunch the next day too!) to offer the irreplaceable comfort that is great mexican food. It's what you would (should) expect from a mexican establishment in this part of town. The interior isn't much, but you know what that means - they make DAMN GOOD FOOD. 

Yes, most of the time I order their namesake, but there is a reason for that. For $7-8 you can get an amazing swaddle of meat, beans, rice, cheese, and everything else that warms your stomach and your heart as quickly as sodium can distribute through your arteries. Just kidding, it's not really that salty, I just like to add salt to my chips and snack on them relentlessly while I wait for my order. Yes, there are chips that you can self serve in the back. They also have a couple of good salsas, and their spicy one really is VERY hot. I was impressed, as I am one of those foolish people who enjoys the burning tingle on my lips. 

Their quesadillas are also pretty good, and I have ordered the tostada de ceviche once and it was piled with seafood! Stomach and wallet are happy, so I am too.

So come here for some good Mexican food if you are tired of Taco Bell a couple of streets down.
author: Kevin S.

description: I honestly dislike writing bad reviews and have given this place more than a few chances, but more often than not it has been a disappointment. I have gotten orders wrong, forgotten, and the food is mediocre at best. I have had burritos and tacos alike that were much better coming from a local taco truck than from this place. If you're looking for "fast" Mexican food or simply need sustenance due to intoxication, come here. If you are looking for real good Mexican food, try checking out the mission district instead.
author: Killah K.

description:
Decided to go Mexican today and was told this place would be the place to go in the neighborhood. Decided to go with the namesake, the Super Burrito, which was your choice of meat (carne asada, pollo, carnitas, al pastor, lengua, chile verde, chorizo, cabeza, or BBQ chicken), rice, beans, guacamole, cheese, and sour cream, and I got it wet (smothered in a sauce and you could choose cheese & tomatillo or enchilada... I went with enchilada). I also ordered the California Fries, which were one of today's specials which are fries covered in the meat of your choice then cheese then all that covered in guacamole, sour cream, and salsa. And a Mandarin Jarritos, because when you can drink Jarritos, you should. I was also told to get the salsa because it was described to me as "good enough to just drink on its own". And so I got little cups of all three.
The burrito was beyond amazing. Truly super. Filled with fresh ingredients and covered in a delicious red sauce. The California fries were even more impressive. Layer upon layer of flavor. Both together was way more than one person should be able to handle. And the sauces... The red and green were delicious with a good amount of heat but the habanero blew the roof off my skull. Not for the faint of heart (like myself), so fortunately I only sampled it. The food was great here and the service I got when ordering came with a great smile and attitude. The food was delivered to my table very fast (and there was quite a lunch time crowd here). The surroundings weren't that great (reminded me of a run down Taco Bell) but who cares... The food was incredible (well priced for what you got) and good service and those trump locale every time in my book.
author: Roger M.

description: Tasteless. If it wasn't for the sauces i took. I would have not eaten it. That being said the sauces are "OKAY".  I gave 2 stars because it was cheap. U know what they say, you get what you paid for.
author: Uuganbayar U.

description:
I am a huge huge fan of Mexican food, but there are unfortunately not too many options around Lower Pac Heights. But El Super makes that up for me.

It's  not the cleanest or fanciest place, but the food here is authentic and delicious. I always order the super burrito or huevos rancheros and would highly recommend it !
author: Harihara N.

description: Best California Burrito in the world. Crispy fries inside. Perfect ratio of ingredients mixed evenly throughout.
author: Cameron D.

description: I've been eating here over the last 4 years and I keep coming back. They make a mean "burrito regular" that keeps it simple and tasty. I think they stay busy which is hopefully why the tables aren't always clean. For SF you get reasonably priced and delicious food.
author: Charles B.

description: This is my go to spot for menudo on the weekends. Every other thing I've had here is okay, but the menudo is based. Props to super burrito for keeping it real Mexican and not cutting their menu too much to cater to more Americanized taste.
author: Ozy S.

description:
So...the thing about walking into a hole in the wall without reading yelp reviews is that there's a big chance it's actually a little shit attached to the wall. 

Let me save you some time if your skimming through, I read a previous review where a lady found a PUBE in her burrito and another saying they had food poisoning. 

Now, if you'd like to read my review go right along...

We didn't read reviews before entering. Horrible mistake. Its just that my bf doesnt like that im picky and we were really hungry. I halved a burrito with bf. We took turns on using the restroom to wash our hands. I went up the steps and gosh darn it, I felt like I was walking up the steps to my death. Everything in this restaurant is old and they don't do anything to make it look clean/updated. My bf said in the boys bathroom, there aren't any doors to the shitter stalls and he walked in while an employee was shitting. I quickly washed my hands and darted back down. 

One upside is BOTTOMLESS chips!!! I wouldn't try the pickled jalepenos. But the sauces are good and spicy like I like it. 

On to the burrito!!! It wasn't appetizing. We ordered half tongue half chicken. Both meats were very salty. 

THIS PLACE IS A SKIP.
author: Lynn C.

description: I thought the 3 star average was very fair. It's good but not great. I thought the carne asada tacos were real good. The salsa is good too. But the place isn't super clean. Also the guacamole is just not good. It's like watered down guac. Anyway, I would say that if you want decent fast Mexican food, give it a try!
author: Justin S.

description:
Great find next to my new place. Tried this today for lunch with the bf since it was close and convenient and it did not disappoint. We both love good Mexican food and this was great. 

I got the wet burrito with red sauce and the bf got steak fajitas. My burrito was amazing but they shouldn't call it a wet burrito they should call it a drowning burrito!  There was so much sauce! At first I was a little scared but the sauce was delicious. The inside of the burrito was the star. The carnitas were the best I've had. Perfectly moist and crispy.  What was great was that there was rice in the burrito but not too much! And the tortilla was so good. I don't even know how to describe it but it was perfection. My complaint of the place was the the guacamole that my bf got with his fajitas. It didn't look like guacamole. Almost like tomatillo salsa. It was that thin and liquidy. It really looked like fake guacamole that you squeeze out of a bag. 

The thing I really loved is the self serve chips and salsa bar. My sister and I love chips and salsa so I can't wait to take her here just because of that. The salsas were so good too! I loved it.

Overall, this was a great find. I definitely see myself coming a lot in the future.
author: Sabrina D.

description: I have eaten here several times. Most recently, the grilled chicken in my super burrito was ridiculously salty. I couldn't stomach more than half of it despite not having a bite to eat until 3 pm that day. I shared the other half (aka getting a second opinion) with my spouse and he needed to dilute it with a blander food.
author: Lily T.

description: Food is good but they added a $1 charge not on the menu then argued with me when I pointed it out--even though I was simply asking them to update their menu if they were going to charge it. Shameful.
author: CA B.

description: Overpriced, overhyped, card fees with no set spending minimum... Burrito was okay, but I'd rather eat at Chipotle, TBH.
author: Joe M.

description: El super burrito? More like el terrible burrito. This place is comparable to fast food drive through quality. I got a chorizo/bacon breakfast burrito and asked if it came with eggs and potatoes, she said yes. Waited 20 min for my burrito and opened it in the car to bite into 3 mouthful of refried beans. What the heck? There was also no potatoes! So much for a breakfast burrito, more like a bean and cheese burrito-----worst burrito I've ever had, don't order this. It was soggy and mushy. I question other orders on this menu as well.
author: Ting Ting C.

description: Carne asada taco- great price, huge portion (tortilla runnethed over). Good food. Good bargain.
author: Johanna S.

description: mehh flavor wasn't amazing and the prices weren't fair either (used to Socal taqueria's). The tortilla chips are self-serve and they have a salsa bar, but the day I went, the chips were stale and they had no pico de gallo!
author: Amanda K.

description:
Since my husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco we didn't really know the go to spots, but we were very hungry after a gnarly hike in Muir woods, we just wanted to eat something darn good! And with the help of yelp we found this place. 
APPEARANCE & LOCATION: Its not the most appealing in appearance but neither is the whole lower nob hill area that this place sits. So, yeah factor that in before you rate it low for appearance. You cant expect an elegant looking restaurant in a rough neighborhood. But I'd like to mention that although it wasn't the nicest looking, it was clean. And I very much appreciated having not just a clean table but a clean environment. There was no bad odor present. 
FOOD: I ordered the (wet) Super burrito with Al pastor. I told the young lady, before ordering, that I didn't want the hot sauce (bc although I love the taste of hot sauce, I have a low tolerance for chili's my sinus will even act up. Loseri know). But the Lady said that none of their sauces were hot, so I chose the green one.  Once the order came i took one bite and yowzers it was hot (again, this is coming from a chili panzy. Taco bell hot sauce is too hot for me most the time too). I was able to exchange my green wet burrito to a red one. And it was deeeeeelicious! So was the green sauce burrito (a side note for those of you chili risk takers out there.) my husband ordered the wet chimichanga with al pastor. That was good too but not as good as my wet burrito.
There is also a chips and salsa bar, for free, and all you can eat. And it was pretty good!
PRICES: chimichanga $8.25 wet super burrito $7.50. Cant complain on these prices. That's sort of unlikely these days, especially in SF. You cant even get parking for that price haha.
CUSTOMER SERVICE: The girl that took our order was nice and even when i returned my first wet burrito to her saying that it was too hot, She was kind enough to let me try the other sauce to see if it was okay for me. The cook or owner (not sure who he was) but a man came out and helped out by taking the burrito back and making me a new one with the not so hot sauce. I was very satisfied with their customer care.

A 4 star to this place for excellent customer service, prices and tasty and generous servings of food! 

Muey bueno to this place!
author: Rayonica C.

description: not the best, but definitely not the worst. it's great when you're craving Mexican but don't wanna go to the mission. all their meat regardless of whether  it's al pastor or asada seems to all taste the same, not very flavorful. the servers are always fighting amongest themselves too,and it can feel like hostile environment with the employees and the local TL residents. It's a great place for gossip, everytime I'm here there is a table with some dirty deeds.
author: Sabrina D.

description: Very Gross and expensive. Two tacos came out to eleven bucks. Menu is confusing and they try to up sell you on food. I got the fish tacos - smelt funky. Adios!
author: Hanna A.

description:
Eating here occasionally for the past five years and loving it. You definitely get what you paid for, or even more. Veggie burrito under seven bucks (that's including tax!) their rice and beans taste pretty good,  never dry. Salsa bar always fresh. 
Also they got very good torta and chicken soup
author: Iaroslav K.

description:
The food itself is pretty tasty, especially in an area that doesn't have too many other Mexican food choices. I'm tossing in extra points for having a free salsa and chips bar (definitely go with the habanero salsa if you can handle a little heat).

Is it a Mission-level burrito? Well, no. Do I hate trekking all the way to the Mission, where parking is a horror show, just to grab some carne asada? Yes. Is my rating partially, ok 100% attributed to my laziness? Definitely.

4 stars!
author: Warren W.

description:
As a lot of other reviews mention, the carnitas here are amazing. I can see why people would give this place three stars if they had any other meat, but get a taco or burrito with carnitas and you won't regret it. 

Plus they always play soccer on the TV if there's a game on.
author: Mario N.

description: I just saw a co worker come in with a big juicy burrito. I just met him today so I couldn't just two  a bite like I wanted to LOL but omg I'm about to go later and it sucks because I already had lunch but the way his burrito looked turned me on. So I'll update this review later when I actually try it but OMG he killed it less that 7 minutes.
author: Chanel D.

description: Closest thing you will find to an authentic Mexican place in Nob Hill or the surrounding areas. Get the burrito wet and share it or turn it into two meals. Sounds odd to get this excited but the free chips and salsa they have are amazing. I've tried to replicate the recipe with no luck.
author: Kyle F.

description: The best burritos in downtown hands down I had their breakfast burrito was off the chain and there California fries aka nacho fries was fire. And they are on par with mission burritos
author: Russel R.

description: I love their tacos. I live nearby and this is a go-to tasty affordable meal.  I wouldn't expect anything earth shaking, but the variety of meats and dishes, moderate price, and filling portions make this worthwhile if you're looking for a casual bite.  Ambience is super casual, not exactly squeaky clean (but not worried about it being unhygienic), wouldn't bring a date here unless she's really into greasy indie Texmex.
author: Jared S.

description:
Most recent health score is a 70 out of 100. Thats pretty bad. Check it out for yourself: 
https://101g-xnet.sfdph.org:4443/pls/eeop_htmldb/f?p=132:2:544726414440676::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:3286

I've been trying to like this place but every time its a disappointment. Food is mediocre at best and the tables are filthy most of the time. I was going to give one star but the horchata is pretty good so they get another star for that. Ive found inedible chunks of something in the carne asada and  4 out of 5 times my stomach will be in chaos after eating here. I've tried to like this place, I really have... but its just not good.
author: Miguel S.

description: I think I made history.  The most epic diarrhea ever. It was like July four fire works. Independence Day. Ya.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I'm in a yelpy mood.

So, I wanted to update my review since there's been goings on at El Super Burrito ... 

Everything I said before it true, but now they've had a recent remodel, which makes the space nicer and cleaner. They put in a new salsa bar -- more hygienic and with a new habanero salsa (OOOH! OUCH! YUM!) and the same great, crispy, crunchy chips under a heat lamp. Try the habanero, maybe on chips first ... and then slather it on your taco/burrito/quesadilla.

Still won't eat the meat (still meat drawers) -- but that's ok. It's important to eat veggie 15 times out of your 21 meals per week, no?

I always get the same black bean veggie burrito -- the owner sees me & starts making it before I pay. Love that! Which brings me to the reasons you should eat here:

1. Decent respectable food for the price you would expect
2. Family joint -- support our local small family businesses -- otherwise one day you'll wake up and everything with be a Chipotle or Chevy's. Imagine that world....{{{{shudder}}}}
3. Otherwise one day you'll wake up and everything with be a Chipotle or Chevy's. Imagine that world....yes, I meant to repeat this. It's important. Think about it.
author: Yasi S.

description: Would have got 5 stars but the service is slow. The food is tremendous. Best Mexican I've found in this part of town.!
author: Sean L.

description: WARNING: The fish tacos are drenched in cheese, and not fried. On other words, not what you're looking for; avoid. :-(
author: Tom H.

description:
First time in San Francisco and let me tell you, I don't think I've ever ate so much Mexican. This was definitely #1 on my list. 

I ordered a burrito and nachos, both with carnitas. First I want to point out their prices. They're much more reasonable than other areas of the city. 

Both the burrito and nachos were very large. I loved the carnitas in my burrito. Perfectly moist and crispy. My biggest peeve about ordering rice in burritos is they stuff so much in there, probably to cut down on the other ingredients. NOPE. This had just the right amount of rice. 

I came around like 2am after the bars, such great drunk food!! 

Cash only!!
author: Laura G.

description:
Seriously only three stars. My friends who brought me to this place told me that thats because the other itmes on the menu aren't as good as the California burrito. 

THAT CALIFORNIA BURRITO WAS THE BEST BURRITO IVE EVER HAD! And I eat a lot of burritos. 

The trick is you ask for bean spread instead of the pinto beans. also ask for the french fries crispy. 

The other amazing thing is that's the burrito is a BEAST! FOR ONLY $6.50 you could easily eat three times. Seriously though its over whelming. I felt like I was back at Rutgers eating a Grease Truck sandwich. 

Also another great thing they take debit card with no hassle. None of this cash only nonsense.
author: Efti P.

description: Over change with no reason. The old guy who was a cashier couldn't speak English and I can't speak Spanish too. So I couldn't the right name of the food and he didn't understand what I am order.
author: Orange S.

description: Just orders a super burrito and a 1 taco plate.  Cashier tried to charge me for a 2 taco plate.  I caught him.  Then AFTER you pay with a credit/debit card...cashier advises you of a .50 cent fee....
author: Scott H.

description: I'm from the LA area so there lots of good Mexican places to eat,visiting San Francisco I didn't  know what to expect but the burritos were big and good priced for its surrounding places. Definitely would come back.
author: Raymond D.

description: Not too shabby in an area that is full of pizza, pho, Chinese food & everything in between! The prices are moderate for the area & the chips & salsa are self self. The portions aren't so huge so don't feel bad as long as a Zumba class & walking/ urban hiking is done in the same day. It's also spaceport than other eateries in the area!
author: R C.

description: 5 stars for the carnitas taco I always get / 3 stars for the slow service. Kind of obsessed with this place to be honest.
author: Audrey S.

description: I love this place! The people here are super nice. Customer service is awesome!!! The food is very good. The restaurant is always clean when I come in. Not only that but the food is super cheap and delicious. I love how fast your food comes out, that's a plus for me! Specially on my lunch break when I'm in a rush. I highly recommend people to come and check them out. The chicken burrito is my favorite!
author: Margarita V.

description:
Every time we play regency ballroom I eat here at least once sometimes twice.  I don't really get anything other than burritos so I can't say much for the rest of their menu but I think their burritos crush it.

They even have me the wrong burrito this morning and it was so good that I wasn't even mad.
author: Blake R.

description:
1) Order 3 Carnitas Tacos
2) Try to restrain yourself from ordering more
3) Fail miserably
4) Look around and feel sorry for everyone else who didn't order said tacos
5) Come back 50 times
6) Secretly judge every restaurant in SF for their inferior tacos

Carnitas Tacos - 5 Stars
Everything else - Who cares?

Minus 1 star for ambiance.
author: Paul W.

description:
The search for good mexican food in the city continues.  This place was decent, the burrito was alrite, so so, medium amount of awesome.  

Came with my coworker for lunch, the burrito was very large and filling, so that was a plus, but there was just something that wasn't as good about it as other places I've been to.  Maybe the meat? nah, that was good. It was just a combo of things.  

I'll save my mexican food cravings for the east bay or san jose, you know, where there are actually mexican people.
author: Tu T.

description:
This restaurant was around the corner from my hotel while I was vacationing in San Francisco. 

I'm a sucker for a good burrito and this place gave me one of the best I've eaten. Perhaps that's because every other one has been from a place in the frozen north but nonetheless I had a great meal here. 

The staff was friendly and the food was flavourful and reasonably priced.
author: John M.

description: I am in town for business training, and my hotel said this place is good. Now I am from Los Angeles, and we have great Mexican food there. I had a regular steak burrito, meat was dry, rice, etc was flavorless. Yes the portions are huge, but who cares if the food doesn't taste good! It was quite busy, and the service is nothing special either. The girl who brought my food didn't even great me or smile or anything. Hate wasting my calories on fattening food that isn't worth it. UGH!!!!
author: Lynne A.

description: Went today and got the super nachos. For the price the portion isn't that big. The food was so-so. I've definitely had better. The nachos didn't come with beans, which I find odd. The guacamole looked store bought. I probably won't be back and if I do I wouldn't order the nachos again.
author: Lacey L.

description:
El Super Burrito definitely doesn't get enough credit. My coworkers and I trek up Polk street once every 2 weeks to fill our bodies with carbs, grease, and a whole bunch of salsa. The 4 of us usually order 3 items and share amongst ourselves - perfect amount. 

Quesadillas aren't the typical large tortilla folded in half and grilled. The quesadillas here are made up of 2 small fluffy tortillas with meat and cheese in the middle and topped with the works if you order the super. We always order the regular with just meat and cheese.

Burritos are huge and the wet burritos are tasty. You can choose between red and green sauce. We've never tried the green, but the red is tasty and doesn't taste like a can of spaghetti-o's. 

Nachos are loaded with toppings and seem to not have enough chips to support the fiasco on top, but not to worry, there's a chip bar in the back. AYCE chips and salsa! They also offer California nachos (French fries instead of chips)

Sharing amongst ourselves, we never go over $6 each.
author: Cheryl Q.

description:
This review will be divided into two parts.  The first is how I ended up at El Super Burrito.  If you are not interested in my walkabout, you can skip down to the "Restaurant Review" section.

Every once in awhile, I want to go out for dinner.  But I lack the social energy or desire to reach out and find someone to dine with.

So, I go on a dinner walkabout.  This consists of simply picking a direction and starting to walk.

There are only three rules.

1.  No doubling back.  If I decide to pass up a restaurant, that's it.   I have to go forward.

2.  No research until I am committed. 

3.  Must eat somewhere new.

In the evenings, I will often go north.  This takes me to Chinatown and onto North Beach.  Finding a restaurant walking north is pretty much like shooting fish in a barrel with a 12 gauge shotgun.

Heading south is also a pretty easy way to go.  That takes me right downtown into the Union Square area.

In the daytime, going eastward down the hill into the Fi-Di can also be fruitful.

However, this evening, I decided to make it a real challenge.  I decided to head west on Pine.  For restaurants, this is a pretty barren stretch.

Rue Lepic was up first.  But I was not in the mood for French.  Plus, walkabouts are more about finding great hole in the walls.  Nob Hill Grille was next.  But, for similar reasons, this also did not strike my fancy.

Up a block on California, I spotted what looked like a restaurant.  It was a bar.  I thought about popping in for a drink but decided that I would soldier on.

Across the street, there was a Thai place.  But it was pretty empty.  So,  I continued down California.  I finally made it to Polk.

Now the decision was to either head north or south on Polk.  I know more about the area north.  But, I decided to head south.

There actually were quite a few restaurants.  These were Thai and Middle-Eastern.  That really wasn't what I was in the mood for.  Finally, I spotted a Mexican place.  That sounded pretty good to me.  There were quite a few people in the restaurant.  I decided that was the place for me.  And that is how I ended up at El Super Burrito.

Restaurant Review

First, I am going to start with ambiance.   I would call it "Mexico meets McDonald's".  Gotta love the swivel charis attached to the tables.  Pretty much all of the available seating options were a tight fit for me.   I will say the place seemed spotless.  If you like bright yellow, this could also be the place for you.

Like many Mexican restaurants, you order at the counter and you either pick up the food or they bring it to your table.

The woman at the counter was very friendly.  There was a warmth to her personality.

I decided on the carne asada platter.

It wasn't very long before the food came out.   The platter looked very good.   The meat was pretty tender.  The guacamole was more like an avocado cream.  I had asked for a mix of corn and flour tortillas and they obliged.  Like most asada platters, there was Mexican rice and beans.  Both of these were tasty.

I piled the ingredients onto my tortillas and went to work.  I enjoyed it.  The only thing I didn't eat was the grilled green onions.  They did not look that appetizing.  But, upon reflection, I should have probably given them a try.

It was a very healthy portion.  Upon finishing, I certainly wasn't hungry.

http://tinyurl.com/7dyjdsv

They also have a self-serve chips and salsa bar.  At first, I didn't even notice.  But, after I had ordered, I decided to check on Yelp.  One of the reviews mentioned.  It was a nice touch and helped round out the platter. 

Overall, I liked the place.  The staff including the cook were very friendly.   The food was good.  The price was right.  The ambiance is a little funky but it didn't get in the way with digging into my meal.
author: Mark D.

description:
Not bad but a little on the dry side. The meat quality is good but overall not really worth my time. 

The restaurant is clean and well organized but the music comes from a little TV that sounds like a clock radio turned up too loud.

I didn't finish the entire carne asada and I wonder if I'm being too generous with the three stars.

I won't be back.
author: Justin S.

description:
Average. I would give it three stars, but it didn't quite earn the 3rd, so I have to unfortunately stick with two..

Just ate here pretty late tonight. I like that its open late, but the neighborhood is obviously sketch so I don't know if eating here late on the reg is a good thing, so it might not matter...

However,  I was hungry and needed to trek to bart and then take it all the way home to Berkeley, so figured I would eat before the journey. I ordered the jumbo carne asada, pinto beans, spinach tortilla burrito, and apparently the only difference between the super and the jumbo is that the jumbo has lettuce and tomato. Kinda weird that they make you pay more for lettuce and tomato but whatev...

The burrito was HUGE and I am so full, but the quality was not the highest. So basically I just ate a TON a mediocre crap. Which is exactly how I feel right now. 

The salsa bar was extremely boring and limited with only red and green sauce. I would say that I would come to this place again, but only out of desperation, and not by choice.
author: Alanna R.

description:
The torta was awesome and pretty big. I loved the salsa and chip station in the back, free chips with your meal.

Over all I think this was a good cheap place to snack at.

I gave three stars because the cleanliness of this place is questionable.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
Alright so I'm in San Francisco and decided it was time for a burrito. Hit the Yelp app and saw all kinds of Mexican places around me. El Super Burrito's name stuck out at me so I went for it. Later on I learned that El Super Burrito actually means "The Super Burrito" in Spanish. Crazy. 

So you walk up to this place, and there's crazy homeless people and weirdo hoodlum youths hanging around the place. Some old black dude in an Orlando Magic Shaq jersey was screaming wildly and waving his arms as I was walking up. Not for the timid of heart. But I ain't never scared. 

So I walk in and it feels just like any legit traditional Mexican restaurant that I've ever been to across the country (SoCal, Chicago, San Antonio, El Paso, Miami, etc.). Good start. I see the menu has lengua on it, so that seals the deal on it being authentic in my book. I ordered the "Super Burrito" with "carne asada". That's a super burrito with grilled steak, for all of you stupid gringos out there. This burrito comes with rice and beans and sour cream and guacamole and salsa. Not one ingredient overpowered any other and they all tasted awesome. Definitely super.

Futbol was on TV. You may not know this, but that's what Mexicans call soccer. I liked that.

Oh and they have Mexican Coke in bottles. Score.

My friends got some things they said were sub-par, but fuck those guys, my food was great. 

VIVA EL SUPER BURRITO!
author: Joshua S.

description:
I live a couple blocks from El Super Burrito, so it's my main spot for Mexican. I work close to the Mission, so I'll go get a burrito around 16th or 24th on the reg.

I have to say, these burritos are just as good as the Mission burritos. If you're not feeling burrito-ie, grab a taco or two. They're pretty big and tasty.
author: Joe H.

description:
I have found my new burrito place. Carne Asada Super Burrito. Be still my beating heart. It was AMAZE. 

I'm always on the lookout for good burritos since lately my go-to place has been struggling on providing me something worthwhile(I'm looking at you Panchos). I always have walked by El Super Burrito and thought it looked not super inviting, but finally decided to head inside yesterday since I was on the hunt. Best decision of my Sunday.
author: Melinda S.

description:
Wasn't bad, price was expected, and food was filling. I had a very large burrito that I'll have to finish tomorrow. I only stopped in since it was on the corner down the street, I saw burrito and got excited for some tasty salsa. Salsa was ok... I have had better, and I've had worse. Since I'm visiting I probably won't eat there again, it's a quick meal if you don't want to try very hard.

Girl behind the counter was very nice, and helpful! Thanks for the tip on the Jumbo lol.
author: Sarah P.

description: A solid burrito place, with fast service close to my work, not much more I could ask for.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
My carnita burrito was tasty!  The rice was cooked in a broth, making it very savoury as well.

However, the tastiness comes with a price.  It took over 13 minutes to make the burrito, too long in my books.

Tip: Use cash... Credit cards are 0.50 extra
author: Vinh M.

description:
Suuuper authentic Mexican food.

Not the best burrito I have ever had, but it was good.

DONT get the chicken... You hardly get any and you can't taste it.  My friend got steak and was way more stoked.

"The bathroom looks like a scene out of saw III." - Joe H

The new "re-model" is pretty funny too.  Love the paintings!
author: Ryan W.

description:
My burrito was a pleasant surprise after an excellent Sunday Funday - not just a good location. The Super felt like it weighed more than a pound, and maybe two. And not too salty, which is rare. I ordered chile verde, or spicy pork, which was fine but not great. Next time however, carne asada or bbq pork might be a better idea.

Pro Move: pay in cash and save a 50c charge.
author: Mike H.

description:
All that I've heard about the good Mexican food in San Francisco is that there isn't any. So I had my reservations when I went to El Super Burrito (for you Gringoes, that's Spanish for "The Super Burrito").

I had the Super Nachos with beef. I also had a bite of some Enchiladas. Granted I was a tad tipsy from Bar hopping on Polk St., I thought that both were delicious. The nachos were so tasty. The chips were greasy and freshly made, there was a copious amount of both sour cream and guacamole (though the guac was just so-so). The salsa was good too. Yeah, my mouth was a happy camper. For nachos that are just $6.50, these definitely met and exceeded my expectations for cheap greasy Mexican food. 

Staff was super friendly too. Oh, and they have Squirt. I love Squirt =P

I'll be coming back here the next time that some good Mexican food strikes my mood (which I assure you will be soon). I'd like to come back here when I'm completely sober too so that I can get a more accurate assessment. Expect an updated review at some point down the road.
author: Vivian A.

description:
I am a "Carnitas Connoisseur" and this place has some of the best carnitas that I have ever tasted!  This place is conveniently located on Polk near some of my favorite bars like "R Bar" and "McTeagues" so it is perfect for those after bar munchies.  They offer free chips and salsa, AND the staff is comprised of mostly attractive young Latinas.
Muy Bien!
author: Matt S.

description:
We had a specific request from the group -- we needed guacamole -- so we were on a quest to find some late on a Thursday evening.

I Yelp'd for possibilities in the neighborhood, one of them was El Super Burrito. Since I live in the 'hood, I have walked by it a million times but only eaten there twice. Our options were very limited and it was as good as any other place.

We started walking towards it ; it was close to closing when we finally got there. Apprehensive about the situation, I asked about their guacamole, trying to determine if it was going to satisfy the members of the group. The gentleman behind the register (owner) assured me that it was made fresh, but we were told it was more like a sauce for tacos/burritos (runny) instead of something thicker. We huddled and decided that this was fine with us and we bought a bowl of it.
I got several containers of their salsa (good!) and a plate of their chips waiting for the guac. When it finally came to the table we dug in, setting expectations accordingly. I added some of the hot sauces to the guac to give it some more flavor, and we were happy.

The same guy came by 10 minutes later with a FRESH bowl of guacamole in his hands. He told us that he saw on the face of one of us that it wasn't satisfactory (not true) and thought that he would make real guacamole for us -- it had at least 3 avocados, tomatoes, onions, roasted peppers, etc. This was the REAL deal and tasted fantastic !!

All three of us were blown away with 1. the customer service, 2. the freshness of the guac. Really. 
I got some more chips and several other Coronas so that we could finish the new bowl of guac. At this point we were on cloud nine because of the perfect ending to a already wonderful evening out with friends.

Really, we were blown away. I'd give 10 stars if I could.
author: FrOg SoU P.

description:
Jarritos + Fresh Homemade Chips & Salsa = Happiness In My Stomach!!

I love this place, because with a purchased meal, you get to ENJOY their free fresh homemade chips & salsa. Their meals are just A-OK, I usually purchase something small and load up on their chips. Their salsa is THEEEEE best I've ever had. For that, I'm going to give them an extra star.

Soft Taco w/ Pollo Chicken
http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FemxD8-lOkgr72Heh7Ih5A/l

(Sunday, June 20, 2010)
author: Kenny C.

description:
Came in for the Shrimp Taco special --- 2 Tacos for $6.99 which did not disappoint along with a $3.25 import beer. The Tacos were beer battered and perfectly crisp while having a generous portion size.

Seemed to be worth visiting if in the area.
author: Brian D.

description:
My coworker goes to this place often so I thought i'd go and try it as well.

I ordered the regular chips which included gauc, cheese, sour cream, salsa. It was a little weird because I've never had melted cheese underneath my chips. It tasted pretty good but the consistency was eh...the gauc wasn't thick, the cheese made all the chips stick together from the bottom while the rest of the toppings laid on top. 

I also ordered the regular carne asada burrito which included beans, rice, little bit of tomatos and jalapenos. I'VE HAD BETTER. I wish the beans were mushier, the carne asada was dry. 

It's an ok place if you really need some mexican food but its not the best. The price makes it bearable though. Nice that they have all-you-can eat chips and salsa bar.
author: Jean T.

description:
Having recently moved from So Cal to SF, I have been dying to find a good mexican spot. After months of eating, poor, sub standard fare, I have finally found a spot that I can recommend to friends and fill the void. Who doesn't love free chips and salsa?

I live like a block or so from here and have quickly become a regular. My two favorite things on the menu are their wet super burrito in chicken or el pastor and their California burrito (carne asada, guac and french fries for you non SD people). I also recommend trying their orange juice and carrot juice if you and hung over.

I don't know why people are giving this place low stars. If you want a fancy dining experience this isnt the spot, go to mama citas or don pistos or something. If you want real taqueria style burritos and tacos, this is your jam
author: Andrew G.

description:
When you are looking for inexpensive, good, and large portion meal, this is the PERFECT place for it.  
When everything is getting expensive nowadays, this place still charges same price for a longest time.
author: David O.

description: I eat here for lunch all the time and its consistently good. Great veggie tacos. Unlimited chips and salsa with your meal!
author: Brett M.

description: Great place to go if you want something big in the mornings they open at 9:00am and ready to serve. Nice big place inside and there is a bus stop in front of building. 19 muni.  The Best thing I like is there  regular burritos and chips.
author: Anthony G.

description: I found myself in the Tenderloin on Saturday afternoon because I wanted to watch the Oregon Ducks football game at R Bar, a designated Oregon bar in SF.  I hadn't eaten before the game because I figured a designated college football bar would have food, but alas, it did not.  So at half time my friend and I went on a search.  It was a very short search, because right next door was El Super Burrito!  The food is fantastic taqueria deliciousness.  My smothered burrito was soo soo soo good.  The array of salsa was great and the chips were also delicious.  I highly recommend it, and will probably be coming back most Saturdays next football season!
author: Allison R.

description: Have had enough burritos in SF to know the good from the bad. I had the super chicken burrito and it hit the spot, at the right price. For those of you talking about health scores, well, taquerias are not the best place to worry about it.
author: Gaurav A.

description:
Decent food. Not the best burrito I've ever had, but it worked and fulfilled my craving. I like that the chips are free with your purchase. I'd like different tortilla selections, and some hearty guacamole. I don't like when I can see through guacamole. The meat was good, beans were too. 

Overall 3 stars. I wouldn't eat there -- better for take out. They have futbol on a big screen which is nice to watch while you wait.
author: Sherae H.

description:
Tuesday, September 17, 2013                               4PM PST

Lawrence-Cobalt Janssen      
1000 Sutter Street, Suite 222
San Francisco, California 94109
Telephone: 415/ 572-8511
Email: lawjanssen@gmail.com 

El Super Burrito
1200 Polk Street
San Francisco, California 94109
Telephone: 415/ 771-9700
        
Re:  El Super Burrito-Negative Service Experience with Inappropriate Responses, from 
       the Front Cashier Order Person-Who Also Filled Drink Order on Sunday, September 
       15, 2013- @ 8 p.m. 

"You never get a second chance to make a first impression..." -Will Rogers
 
Dear El Super Burrito Owner and Management, 1200 Polk Street, San Francisco,
        CA, 94109:

If you need, a visual of who I am, I'm guy with cobalt blue hair, large rhinestone earrings-in both ears, and about six (6) feet tall. I have lived in the "lower Polk Gulch" area for over six (6) years. I have been amazed, by the transformation of this area, into a very "hip and sleek," place for the twenty-someone's to come out and have a good time. I used to enjoy coming into the El Super Burrito, not any longer, it has become a negative and antagonist place for me.

On Sunday, September 15, 2013- @ approximately 8 p.m., against my better judgment, I decided to pick up a jumbo chicken burrito, chips, and a large strawberry drink. The total of the bill came out to $10.27, I had decided to tip one dollar ($1.00.) It was not money well spent for inferior and marginal service.

As I entered, El Super Burrito was filled with patrons, there were two (2) other people waiting behind me to order. The person, who took my order, was to say the least- uninviting with her customer greeting skills. They were non-existent. It appeared that her looks were almost hostile to me. I knew, I should have left El Super Burrito- immediately, but "like a moron," I thought the situation would improve. It did not!

I presented and used my US Bank Visa/Debit card to pay the bill. She swiped it into her machine. A receipt was presented to me to sign, I did sign it. BUT, I was given no receipt for my records; plus El Super Burrito charges an additional fifty cents ($0.50), to use a debit or credit card for a purchase. I wonder if this is an OK policy with the credit card companies which give El Super Burrito access to their systems.

I was just dumped at the end of this burrito purchase experience. I received no "thank you,' all she did was immediately look to the next customer in line. If I could have videotaped, this El Burrito experience, you could review it for yourself; and determine if my letter is an accurate description of the experience.

I went to the back of El Super Burrito. There I picked up chips, salsa, and some limes to put on my burrito at home. Suddenly, another woman came out from behind the kitchen area, asking who had ordered the super chicken burrito. I politely raised my hand. As she gave it to me, I asked where my large strawberry drink was. I received a very, very quizzical look. Suddenly, the front cashier young woman was behind me, she informed me (QUITE BRUSQUELY) that my drink was located and placed on the front cashier counter.

How was I supposed to now that?! Did she have the courtesy to tell, as she took my order, this location information about the drink? No, she didn't. This end part of this El Super Burrito purchase experience put the "nail in the coffin." Maybe El Super Burrito doesn't need regular return customers. I know, I will not be returning to El Super Burrito again. If I want rude, negative, inappropriate behavior, all I have to do is walk around Polk Street. I don't expect or deserve it, when I'm a respectful and courteous customer.

There food is just OK; it's not spectacular or especially noteworthy. 

I appreciate the time you spent reading this letter. If you have any questions, comments, or need for clarification, please feel free to contact me at:  Telephone: 415/ 572- 8511
Email: lawjanssen@gmail.com
 
Lawrence-Cobalt Janssen                               Tuesday, September 17, 2013
author: Lawrence-Cobalt J.

description:
Nothing to write home about.  Convenient for Polk Street bar hopping and that is probably most of its allure and how it gets a rating more than 3 stars by some folks: the 1:30-scramble-for-food-and-beer-bell-curve.  Staff and location get 5 stars but food is pretty mediocre EXCEPT for the chorizo, egg, potato and cheese breakfast burrito.  That thing is big, cheap and has earned its place in my pantheon of burritos as "The Cure".  Nothing beats a hangover better!  It is pretty much the only reason I order from here...but it is a tasty, tasty, tasty reason.

Free chips and salsa but to be honest, Im not big on stuff that has been sitting out under heat lamps all day free to any grimy pair of hands (and it gets very GRIMY around these parts) that cares to delve in the tub.  

Overall, solid drunk food but only middle of the road sober food...except for "The Cure"!
author: Mark C.

description:
I live around the corner and was always weirded out by the looks of this place. It looks like a total hole in the wall, and that's exactly what it is - and it's delicious!

Can't go wrong with the carne asada platter. Ever. Their super tacos/burritos are good as well. It's not the most AMAZING mexican I've had, but it's good. Decently priced, you get what you pay for.

Free chips, green salsa and a beer .. Love this place.
author: Natasha H.

description:
I don't care how interesting the 80's Mexican soap operas are that play on the TV. If guacamole needs me to throw all kinds of crap in it just to make it tolerable then that's not right. I added salsa, salt/pepper, and jalepenos and even after busting my ass I still threw half of it away. If you knew me at all you'd know I'm more likely to throw out a human baby than throw out guacamole. I don't hate babies, I just really like my guac.

It's not even that the taste was "bad", it just tasted like nothing. I'm telling my friend about this awfulness and she says "Oh, like it tasted just like plain avocados huh.." No, I like plain avocados too, this just tasted like nothing at all. Consistency was weird, awkwardly creamy.

I tried to get a Tecate as it was on their menu: out of Tecate. This whole trip to get a quick drink and some chips and guac was a complete epic fail.
author: Justin N.

description: Good, inexpensive, fresh Mexican food. The also make fresh juices. Lots of options to choose from.
author: Kevin-louis B.

description: This was simple but good. The atmosphere is kinda so so but the food wasn't bad. I had half beef half chicken supper burrito. Liked the salsa and chips but some chips were in the main salsa bowl.
author: Giuseppe C.

description:
Came here trashed before a concert at the Regency Ballroom down the street. 
walked in ordered ourselves carne asada burritos (3 of us) 
each burrito was only 6.25, surprisingly cheap for SF
It came wrapped in foil & it was extremely delicious & a decent portion size, best part, you can taste all the ingredients in it & it wasn't mushy like alot of these places. 
Or alot of these places will give you huge portions but lacks in flavor & content. 
Will deff go back if im in that part of SF
author: Brandon M.

description:
This place is in a pretty convenient location for me.  Not outstanding food, but since I don't eat meat, the rest of the stuff isn't hard to do.  And it's pretty cheap.  But, when they consistently give me the opposite of what I order, the rest doesn't matter.

But, the penultimate time that I went, I ordered my the nachos.  No meat - just lettuce.  Instead, I get no lettuce, and stuffed with meat.  Unfortunately, I'd gotten it to go, and only noticed after I got home.  I'm tired after a long day, and I'm not in the mood to go back, so I just spend the time picking out the meat, and vow that, next time, I'll make a big deal out of it, and check my food before I leave the restaurant.

So, next time, I forget to make a stink when I order, but when she hands my order to me, she asks, "You just wanted lettuce and no meat?", so I know she knew what I ordered.  But, I get back home, and it's the same effing thing!  So, I get in my car, spend 15 minutes looking for parking, find a spot 3 blocks away, get there, and she's super apologetic, and gets the guy that made it, and he redoes my order.  When he hands it to me, he says, "It's not my fault, I just make what she tells me".  F!U!  She repeated my order correctly when she told me.

Never again.
author: masa s.

description:
I came by here for the first time to pick up burritos for a friend and I for dinner.  This place came as a recommendation from him and I'm always up for finding good, fast, and easy to get burritos!  Being located around the corner works out perfect for me.

I picked up a regular chicken burrito and a veggie burrito.  While waiting, I looked around the place. The salsa bar is intriguing, but I didn't grab any chips so I didn't try it. It's all you can eat and I saw people filling up on nachos and salsa pretty regularly.  

Turnaround time for two burritos was a bit longer than I would have expected, but service was very friendly and the price what you would expect for standard burritos.  My order was packaged up in a brown bag and I headed off to my friend's place.

I found the burritos to be a really good size, more than enough for a dinner.  Stuffed full of rice, veggies, meat and tasty goodness, these were pretty decent burritos and I was quite happy with it.

Definitely a place to check out if you're looking for good, inexpensive burritos and would like to avoid large chains like Chipotles (which there's nothing wrong with, I actually really like their burritos too!)
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Why all the bad reviews?

-Huge tasty burritos at a good price
-Good carne asada tacos
-Free chips and salsa, both really good

I'm surprised that this place is empty most of the time. I'm happy to return soon.
author: Kiristen R.

description: The foods really good and the location isn't bad either. If you're out and about and need a quick meal to hit the spot, this is a nice easy place to stop.
author: Justin C.

description: I love this place , good food , fresh , salsa station is good ,  veg tacos are super delicious !!
author: Prayank J.

description:
This place is amazing. They've perfected a cooking technique that removes the flavor from any item you might possibly ingest.

Tostada, super burrito & prawn taco salad...all tasted the same, just slightly different textures. 

Some sort of miracle?
author: Leo K.

description: Waited about 25 minutes for a chicken burrito, the order was messed up had to wait again and took forever, finally the burrito was not too shabby though.
author: Phillip L.
