description: My friend and I had a hard time finding vegetarian friendly restaurants in San Francisco, but of the few we found this was one of our favourites. The vegetarian taco salad and the quesadillas were both excellent. The salsa bar was a plus. Next time we're in town we'll be back!
author: Cassius R.

description: Best consistent super burrito I've had yet in San Francisco. Better than Farolito for sure. The really hot orange salsa is also very good and actually hot, not mild hot. This is my go to burrito place so far. Just wish it was a little closer, but worth the trip. With a name like El Super Burrito, the Super burritos better be good and that they are!
author: Rick M.

description: This place is good, but is a dive, the tacos including tongue and tripe are very good, the shrimp cocktail sauce is too sweet, 3 stars because there's homeless people hanging around and you to take out.
author: N A.

description:
Food is hit or miss. Some days its very good, some bland, then there are days when it makes u run to the bathroom. 
They have free chips and salsa bar which is pretty cool.
author: Wallter W.

description:
The carnitis and al pastor are your best choices with bbq chicken not far behind.  Spend the extra $0.50 to get the jumbo burrito.  The lettuce and tomatoes make all the difference.  The place isn't the most cleanly place, but that has never been something to bother me.  They have a chip and salsa bar, love the red salsa, but I can't stand the green.

For credit card orders they add $0.50.  It sucks, but I don't really blame them, more the credit card companies.
~$7 for a jumbo burrito, cash
author: Evan M.

description:
The BEST NACHOS among all the lil Mexican restaurants I've been to in SF. Carnitas that actually have flavor with a little crisp on the edges, so much meat and toppings that you can't see the chips, ... Hello!
Until I find another place, this place wins for nachos. And it's less than $6! (el farolito's nachos... Not so much)
author: mark s.

description:
My favorite menu item is the breakfast chorizo burrito i've never had better.

nachos burritos enchiladas, all good.

Be hungry :)
author: Stephanie D.

description: I really wanted to like this place, and I even gave them a second chance but still failed to meet expectations. Ok, we ordered chimichanga and a super burrito. Food was very greasy. The agua fresca was delicious though, and a lot of different variety of juices too. Second time I ordered 2 tacos and chicken plate. Both were pretty good, better than the burritos but the meat was still greasy and I came to realize their ingredients were not fresh. The chips are store bought, corn tortillas are not even hand made, salsas are not fresh probably came from a can. And there was something about the guac that just wasn't right it was really watery..The only thing fresh was the juice really.
author: Lena E.

description:
Everything about the place is fine.  The service was decent and in a different move for a burrito joint, this place takes cards.  Atmosphere is festive yet laid back.

These things would all be great if the burritos weren't dripping overly salty messes.  The chicken super burrito was big enough but tasted like... hell I don't even really know because it was so salty.  My dining partner came to the same conclusion after 5 bites.   This probably would be an average burrito but if you've even had a sniff of the green burrito fields of the Mission then you'll think this place is definitely subpar in terms of burrito quality. 

If this is a last resort or there nothing else appealing in the neighborhood, I'd probably come here again.
author: Steven R.

description: Being a "college student" when I lived in San Francisco this place was a great find. I would buy the burrito and cut in half, eat it for lunch and dinner. This place is awesome, and I wish I could find something here in El Paso that had the same size for the price!
author: Luis-armando A.

description:
Okay, I honestly thought this place was going to be good. I really wanted it to be, for the restaurant's sake, and for my own. It's so conveniently close to me, and for a place where I can get a holy-crap-huge burrito for $5, well, that's great. Unfortunately it wasn't great. The positives of this place were as follows: 

-Very very clean, at least when I was there. I ordered to-go, but while I was waiting for my order, I noticed staff continuously cleaning the place which was great.

-A small chips and salsa bar inside. It's a help-yourself kind of deal. Glad I noticed it so I could pack a nice little to-go bag of chips with some tasty salsa. I must say this was the best part of my meal. The salsa was nice and spicy, and the chips were decent.

Now for the unfortunates:

-Ordered the vegetarian burrito, no sour cream. The burrito was massive, pretty impressive actually. Hardly ANY guacamole or pico de gallo were in my burrito. It was pretty much all rice, beans, and cheese. I HATED the cheese they put in there too. It just didn't taste good at all. I ended up opening my burrito to eat around the cheese. Then I realized the lettuce was also extremely soggy. Basically the whole thing was just a limp, soggy mess. I threw out the rest of it, which was about 50% of it at least, and just ate the rest of my chips and salsa instead.

-Today my stomach has hurt all freaking day because of it. Blah. I will stay away from this place.
author: Ashley D.

description: The menu is simple and good. Pretty much everything you need for mexican is up on the menu. The food seems to be well prepared and well put together. The only thing I dislike about this place is the pretty slow turn around time with the food togo. It seems like if your eating there then the food comes out quickly but if it is togo then get ready to wait a little longer.
author: Cescilia A.

description: California burritos are amazing. Free chips/salsa make this our burrito go-to.
author: Amanda E.

description:
Dropped in here for some Nachos. Macho, Grande, Supreme nachos.

The Good:
Really can't go too wrong when you throw a pound of cheese, guac and sour cream on anything.

The meh:
Guac was runny, like they mixed it with milk.  Guac should hold it's shape and I should be able to build a fort out of it. My pollo wasn't blackened.  

The bad:
If you forget your contact solution, you can use their emphatically not spicy salsa.
author: Nathan M.

description:
They usually have fresh chips and salsa, not the best, but it works. When you bite into their "carne asada super burrito" you are either getting a bite of ground beef or not so good spanish rice and very little of anything else that is usually included in a super burrito. I've been here a few times and still haven't found anything that was worthy of calling good authentic mexican food. 

It's usually never busy and the prices aren't too bad. It's one of those "desperate for a burrito" places that may disappoint if you've ever a decent burrito.
author: Nate C.

description:
I was heading out for HH and beyond on a total intake of about 400 calories for the day. Yeah, that doesn't work. Or in the sense of being one helluva cheap date, it works quite well. I decided I wanted to go the distance and last more than a few drinks, so I scouted out the first taco I could find. Walking in I thought, hmm, not entirely clean, not a lot of people, but I was hungry. Two carne asada tacos, no cheese. It was 4$ and some change. 

Free chips and salsa bar: I love these and shamelessly make people wait while I gather everything I need in huge amounts. Chips, every salsa except mild, carrots, jalapenos. The little teeny tiny cardboard dish they have for chips is laughable. I used it for jalapenos and carrots instead. When I decide to eat chips, I go all out and that little dish holds about 6 comfortably. They had two salsas out, a red and a green, both not great. Forgettable. 

My tacos were pretty good. They don't skimp on the carne asada. Service was friendly, I even got a wave and a "goodbye" as I headed out the door to martini numero uno.
author: Meg W.

description: Nice staff, good variety of burritos, tacos, and meals. They make a mean breakfast burrito too - will make it with egg whites or however you want to customize it. Lately I tried the shrimp chipotle burrito on their Specials menu which was the bomb - had a lot of shrimp in it! It's kind of a grubby place, and sometimes weirdos wander in, but I've never had a bad experience. Being going here for years. Their green salsa is delicious. You should go there.
author: Barbara K.

description:
I had my go-to standard of pork enchilada plate with horchata.

Pluses:
--huge portions
--unlimited chips and salsa bar
--lots of seating, especially booths
--fast service
--pickled carrot/onion offered in salsa bar with the hot peppers

Minuses:
--salty pork
--red salsa was missing an acidic component (I should have used the lime from the salsa bar)
--no salsa cruda in the salsa bar (just the roja and the tomatillo)
--50 cent surcharge for using credit card under their minimum (I was okay with this)

If I'm still in the area, I'd probably go somewhere else the next time I have a hankering for la cucina mexicana.
author: Ruiqiu K.

description: EXCELLENT food in a casual downtown location.
author: Lisa C.

description:
It looks brand new!  So the outside is all fixed up and the scaffolding is gone, but the inside remains the same.  This shop is a taqueria oasis in the TL and makes pretty decent mexican food.  I always get a super burrito carne asada and my girlfriend always gets enchiladas and we're always pretty satisfied afterwards - not to mention ridiculously full.

Prices are slightly higher than in the mission at my favorite Pancho Villa, but it's still pretty cheap.  They let you get your own chips and salsa which are pretty decent too.

If you don't want to go all the way to the mission then this place is a great fill in spot.  Check it out if you live in the neighborhood and like mexican.
author: Aaron W.

description: Overall the place looks terrible and seating is old and broken. However the food is amazing. I come out to San Fran periodically and the this place is always a stop for breakfast
author: Michael L.

description: Came here for lunch one day with my husband.  We were starving, this was close and our landlord recommended it.  I got the enchiladas, holy moly lots of food.  It came with 3 enchiladas, beans, lettuce, sour cream and rice.  I was only able to finish about half of it, it was so big.  My husband got the super burrito, which he absolutely loved (he fancies himself a burrito connoisseur).  Free chips and salsa.  Perhaps we were just ravenous, but this was very good food.  I'm sure we'll be back.
author: Meaghan P.

description: Great food fast! The employees are always friendly!! The burritos, enchiladas, and flautas are great and portioned very well!
author: Ricky C.

description:
When I used to work in the area, this was my regular lunchtime restaurant.  I love love love the fresh pico de gallo!!!  Where else can you get as much fresh pico de gallo and chips as you want!  The pickled carrots were also very good.  For lunch I would normally get the black bean steak burrito and I didn't get tired of it.  

Oh how I miss El Super Burrito!
author: Erica D.

description:
I wonder whether places that serve bad burritos know that their burritos are bad.  The burritos are so bad at El Super Burrito that I almost hope that they're purposefully pulling a prank on the rest of us.  I'm pretty sure that the employees here run across the street to Subway to eat, because there's no way in hell they get near their own burritos.

What's wrong exactly?  Boy, it's hard to say.  The BBQ chicken (recommended by the order taker, that little conniving rapscallion) features a grossly acidic sauce that will pucker your lips and curdle your innards.  The guacamole was largely absent, save a few pockets of green-shaded puddles.  The salsa?  I had a tomato cube or two scattered in there.  I bravely soldiered on, thinking I was going to hit a good bite, but it never happened.

El Super Burrito: nice prank... ya got me.
author: Laurence W.

description: Been in the area for 2 years. Mexican food is my favorite go to/quick lunch and after several visits to other places and El super Burrito they are by far the best for their area. Food is priced right, all the meats are bomb and chips are free with meal. Don't waste money on their guacamole though. This place is the farthest from my house, but I walk the few extra blocks for their pulled pork burrito! Yum :p
author: Krystle L.

description: I love Mexican food and have never criticized a Mexican places.  But, my lunch today at Super Burrito was the worst Burrito and the worst service I've had in a long time.  They do a lot of take out business but also have sit down.  If you're sitting down, they give you a number to sit on your table.  I paid at the counter, added a nice tip to the tip jar on the counter, took my large No. 28 sign, sat it on my table, sat No. 28 in a prominent place and waited.  And waited, and waited.  Finally I caught the waitress who was scurrying around and asked her to check on my order.  She said she would, so I waited, and waited and waited some more.  I caught her again, this time at the counter.  The person behind the counter said to me that they had been calling out No. 28 and no one had responded.  Not true.  They then stuck my order in the microwave and finally served it to me.  It was dreadful.  It might have been o.k. when it was first made, but microwaved lettuce and sour cream gives you soggy lettuce and liquid sour cream.  As I was leaving I confronted the waitress once again and asked her to explain the delay.  This time she told me that she had called out my number, from the floor.  I asked her why that would have been necessary since there was a large sign on my table saying No. 28.  She really had no excuse.  The obvious truth was that my order got prepared and then overlooked, then the person behind the counter and the waitress both lied about trying locate me by calling out my number.  The cover up lie really is worse than the error.  If they had just apologized and prepared me a fresh order, I would not be writing this review.
author: Margaret O.

description: Favorite burrito place I've found since I moved to the city. I get the vegetarian and my boyfriend tends to get the supreme.Big portions too. Great place!
author: Katie S.

description: Kinda dirty but good burritos. I got really full halfway through but my burrito was good so I forced myself to finish it. Nice and cheap too. That's all really.
author: Rachel P.

description:
I ate here 3 times and I think this restaurant has sanitation issues.   Because...

1. I saw a worker cleaning the floor not washing her hand and started to make food).
2. I saw a worker making a burrito as she was eating some of the meat in it by her fingers. 
3. I ordered Ceviche but it looked and tasted weird... now, as I write this review, my stomach is turning....

Why 2 stars and not 1?  Fish tacos and burritos actuary tasted good here... and they have beer...
author: Chie J.

description:
Two things you might not know El Super Burrito offers:

1. "Free" wifi.
2. Excellent breakfast burritos.

I'm glad my computer found #1 (poaching off someone - thanks!) so I could yelp about #2. I'm very surprised, as I don't remember my regular burrito here years ago as anything too great. But breakfast is a different story.

The guy taking my order customized something not even on the menu - eggs, lettuce, salsa, black beans, wheat tortilla - and we even overcame a bit of a language barrier to get egg whites. Very, very much appreciated that.

Only the price ($7) is getting in the way of me awarding this very good breakfast burrito a full five stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
I used to come here with my Dad as a kid.  And, I remember their burritos being spectacular.  I don't think they have pollo asado, though.
But, my Dad is not much of a cook so I'm sure anything tasted better than what he was cooking back at his place on Bush St.
author: Jacquie L.

description:
Awful, awful and more awful.

The meat is bland, especially the chicken. I don't think they even season it. Also, I ordered a super quesadilla and it came out on two 6-inch diameter tortillas with mostly cheese in between. Whatever happened to using a giant tortilla and folding it in half with everything inside?

A friend of mine got food poisoning from here once. He said it was likely the beef.

It smells funky inside, but has a decent atmosphere. The food quality is just grotesque.

They're cheap, but they're cash-only. The people working here certainly won't be happy to serve you, and their free chips & salsa bar won't make your eyes (or your mouth) water with spiciness. 

Don't go there. Please, just don't.
author: Eliot R.

description:
the closest thing i found to tex-mex.! 

burritos, yum!

taco plate yum-yum!

great customer service, friendly faces, great prices. 

free chips and salsa!!!

***UPDATE***
just had their TAMALES! GREAT....(still not as good as "The Tortilla Factory" in DALLAS)....but GREAT!!!
author: Franziska G.

description:
Yes, this place is not in the Mission, but it is about as authentic Mexican as you can find in SF.  The clientele are mainly Hispanic guys on their lunch hour from various construction jobs, and a large variety of neighborhood hipsters.  The TV is usually blaring a Mexican soccer game. 
The burritos are really good and reasonable.  I love their Lengua (tongue) Regular, but the carnitas one is also really good.  They have a small salsa bar but their hot salsa is good; they give you as many chips as you want.
The woman at the cash register is bilingual and pleasant.  The tables are clean.
This is a straight ahead, no b.s. experience but really authentic and with great burritos.
author: Murray S.

description: I say this to myself every few months, but I swear, THIS IS THE LAST TIME I go to El Super Burrito. perhaps writing a review will remind me how horrible it is.  I've lived in the area for 18 years and periodically frequent the place. last night was the last straw. all I wanted was a bean and cheese burrito to soak up some of the alcohol on my walk home from the Cinch. even as drunk as I was, I took two or three bites of it and tossed it back in the bag. which btw is still sitting on my kitchen counter. for a Mexican place, they have THE WORST tasting refried beans ever. I don't know how you can mess up beans or what they do to theirs, but they're gross. overly salty, and have an overall strange taste. not to mention the rust colored tinge to them. NOT good! I'm sorry but if you can't make decent refried beans then you have no business. Tina's frozen burritos are better than this crap.
author: Mister F.

description: Got a super steak burrito before work....good sized burrito for 6 bucks.  not dry like most spots out in frisco. The decorations make me feel at home.  Def going to be my before work burrito spot from now on
author: Papp J.

description:
After reading these reviews, I expected this to be an unhygienic, TL style taqueria, but this place is more spacious and clean than most taquerias in the Mission. The food is affordable and no better or worse than most San Francisco spots.

It's the best that we have in the neighborhood.
author: Kay H.

description:
The burritos here are nothing more than average.  Cheap.  Big.  But not that good.  

Not worth going to unless you're REAL desperate! 

One plus: bottomless tortilla chips!
author: Scott G.

description:
I'm tempted to give this 5 stars just because I am shocked by the 1 and 2 star reviews and the overall 3 star average at the moment. I passed up this place for 2 years because of the bad reviews. Now, I'm not saying this compares to Mexico City, Texas, or even San Jose but for SF this is a pretty good place.

The Super Burrito al Pastor was fresh and tasted good whether I bit into the rice side or the tasty BBQ Pork side. When I bit into all of it, pure heaven. I'll admit it was oozing grease out of the bottom so there might have been healthier choices but I believe the grease was part of what made it so tasty. Generous portions.

I'm guessing that the people with the bad reviews came in off meal times or late night. Well, I'll tell you refried beans by definition are re-used beans so if you're waiting until the end of the night to eat them, they're not going to be as good as black or pinto beans. So, maybe stay away from this place in non-meal time hours but the food was great other times.
author: Mike T.

description:
Okay so TB is working in this area. We agreed to have lunch together.

Since wehad Mexicanlast night, he asked if its okay for us to have Burrito for lunch. again, how can I say NO to my baby then to food, so I said I'm down. He reminded me not to take the Cable Car this time and use my fast pass and take either Bus 1, 2 or 3 because the cable car cost $5.

So he ordered a Burrito while I order a Super Quesadilla. Im from the Mission, so if I eat else where I need to be wowed. My choice of meat has always been chorizo so whether Burrito, Taco or Quesadilla it has to have chorizo, even my breakfast on Fridays must have chorizo...lol.

TB got the Cantaloupe juice while I got the Mandarin Jarritos. Its all good...its lunch..the days almost over, we were together and the food hit the spot.

You gotta check them out when you're in the hood.
author: Malou C.

description: Place has horrible dried mexican food. I couldn't finish my burrito. The only thing good at this place is the hot sauces in the back. I don't like bashing on mom and pops shops so I will leave it at that.
author: Darin Bom N.

description: I live a few blocks from this place and I  do not know what all the 4 and 5 stars are for. I have eaten here a few times and the only positive thing I can say is I did not get sick. The chicken in the enchilada tasted like it came out of a can. It was mediocre at best. Also you will have to play dodge bum to get in,as that low life factor in and around that place is over 90%. The tables are usually dirty regardless of when you come in.
author: Bob b.

description: Had high hopes of finding a decent burrito on Upper Polk, but not here.  While the burrito was plenty big and stuff with chicken, it just wasn't very tasty and must've been packed with salt.  I drank a gallon of water the that afternoon and was still thirsty.  Guess I'll keep looking.
author: Kevin M.

description:
It's fine but it didn't knock my socks off like the fantastic Mexican food at mid city market. I had the super carne asada burrito. It was OK the beans were overpowering and it was just OK... I'd rather have king taco from home, but I'd totally make the trek to mid city market if i was in the area because there super pollo asado burrito is freaking redonk.

PS mid city market, negra modello, fernet and coke.
author: Dustin R.

description: My favorite taqueria thus far. I will walk past 10 to get to this one. Get the al pastor as a hard taco and you won't regret it. Plus, fresh squeezed carrot juice. Ceviche was tasty as well. Great prices and cool space. Plus, awesome chips and salsa bar.
author: Marina M.

description: Didn't go here because it looks so appealing, but I have to say the food is great. The chips and salsa are free, which is nice to eat while you're waiting for your meal. The burrito that I had was delicious and I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Laura D.

description:
After moving to the neighborhood I was dying to come here but heard horrible reviews from everyone so I never bothered to stop in.

But yesterday some friends and I came in and I was extremely surprised. My friends got two breakfast burritos (but it was 2PM? didnt sound like a good idea..) and I got a veggie burrito with a side of rice and some horchata. The horchata was AMAZING! It was in this huge 7 up cup too but I only paid $2.  My friends loved their meal and tried as best as they could to finish but the portions were pretty big.

So for $8.50 I got a crap ton of delicious horchata, a huge veggie burrito (I could only eat half.. and ate the rest today and it still tasted amazing), rice and chips and salsa. My tummy was definitely satisfied. 

Not the best mexican food I've had but still very yummy.
author: Amanda S.

description: Aww...this place isn't that bad.  Yes, it's kind of dirty (mostly by virtue of location...Polk & Sutter) but not overly so and the food is damn good and dirt cheap.  Burritos with everything are $5.75.  Sometimes they are generous with the meat, sometimes they're not.  But it's not like they skimp -- it's just that they stuff it with so much other stuff.  I agree that the ingredients aren't mixed that well, but I don't mind because it's a surprise in every bite.  Ha, ha.  They even have the weird meats like lengua, tripas, and buche.  Kudos for offering whole wheat tortillas even if they're 25 cents extra.  Menudo on the weekends is HUGE and very tasty too.
author: David A.

description: This place is great! The BBQ pork and carne asada are fantastic, and the burritos are indeed SUPER big. Free chips and 2 fresh salsas seal the deal! :)
author: Todd G.

description:
This place makes the best burritos in town! they really do make a Super Burrito just like the name, lol! my favorite is the Super Burrito with Carnitas, I really like the decor & the atmosphere of this place, you know it's good when lots of latinos come here to eat, they even had a sign on the wall that says "Viva Mexico" the tables have these cool swiveling seats near the windows and plenty of free chips & salsa while you wait for your order, they are very generous on portions, you wont leave hungry, I was stuffed after finishing my super burrito. I cant wait to go back , the fried Tilapia meal looks pretty good, Im ordering that next time.

the service was very fast and the owners are friendly too :)
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
Came here after R bar and needed some grub to sober up a little.  This is how an actual restaurant would look and feel if you were in Mexico.  The decor is a little dated and the food is authentic as it comes.  The chips and salsa are very fresh and it's free.

I had the chicken tacos..........it was ok.  It did the job.  I stole some of my friends steak fajitas.  It was very good.  

It's convenient.  I never realized that polk st is so vibrant these days.  I probably will only come back if I go back to R bar.  I don't think it would be as good if I was sober.
author: jason g.

description: So far I have only tried the taco salad but I will keep going back just for that!!  Plus I can take it to McTeague's and chill :)
author: Devynne H.

description:
It was a pretty good deal for the amount of food you get based on the price, but it was far from the best burrito I have ever had. All the meat and other ingredients were overwhelmed by the sour cream and guacamole. However, it is hard to beat free bottomless chips and salsa.
The place was pretty crowded when I went, so I would definitely give it another try, but I would order something different on the menu.
author: Brady C.

description:
word,

I do love me some El Super Burrito. It may be a combination of being cheap, close to where I live,  but also by the concept of FREE CHIPS. El Super Burrito was the first San Francisco taqueria I ever went to and I did not realize until later that this practice of free chips was not the norm for taquerias in San Francisco, :( sadface.

The food is good as well. Not high end Mexican restaurant level, but good. I've had been going their steadily for five years and have never had a bad burrito yet. The staff is friendly and deliver your food to your table (which is awesome). What makes the place for me is the decor, which looks like a funky hybrid of a McDonalds and a 8 year old Mexican boy birthday party. 

I work in the Mission and have had samplings of other taquerias but in my heart El Super Burrito remains my home base taqueria for cheap, good burritos. El Super Burrito away........

Yups
author: david h.

description:
I feel some creative writing classes are in order here. "El Super Burrito?" Is that the best they could come up with? It's like if someone asked you to think of an alias and all you could come up with is "Fakename Mc Fakeyname."


Because this place is the closest taqueria to my house (and no, I'm not going to count La Salsa. That shit is Taco Bell for yuppies) I come here fairly regularly. Burritos are like bubble baths, if I don't have one at least once a week I get cranky. What? What are you snickering about? ANYWAY...these burritos are not outstanding but their carnitas is pretty decent and overall it's fairly satisfying. The wait for burritos is longer than average but that's cool because it gives you time to watch the strung out transvestite prostitutes stroll by.


Now if you'll excuse me I have to loofah my back. What???!!
author: Josua P.

description: Fresh chips and salsa, serve yourself.  Good prices on large portions.  Beware, expensive drinks and $.50 surcharge on credit cards. ATM machine on site.
author: Philip S.

description: Okay, this place is in the Tenderloin, and their food isn't really that awesome, but it has a strangely difficult to explain place in my heart. The lady at the counter is nice, and the man that cooks looks at you like he wants to slit your throat. The FREE chips bar is delicious, fresh crispy chips with fresh delicious homemade salsa. The creepy homeless men stumbling by the window, the seating that looks like it was stolen from an abandoned McDonalds, and the t.v. that is constantly playing spanish soap-operas all culminate to Super Burrito's strangely charming character.
author: George B.

description: Pretty gross food.beans were still crunchy..not a good sign considering I've been in the bathroom more than usual.rather go to pancho's if I was really craving something edible
author: Ronnie T.

description:
I'm torn.  The burrito wasn't awful, but it was mediocre, at best.  Friendly staff, all you can eat chips (that weren't half bad), and cheap prices ($4.50 for a veggie) are the high points.  The swing out chairs give it a total fast food place vibe.  

I could see myself coming here again due to its proximity to my pad, but I know I'd get a better el super burrito several blocks up at Pancho's.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
There was a pube in my burrito and bugs in my fountain beverage.  Nuff said.

Oh and the burrito was almost 75% full of rice.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
I'm pretty sure I was overcharged.  Like DOUBLE what the menu says I should have paid for my fish taco plate.  Granted it was STILL cheap but it's the principal.  I also asked for chips and guacamole.  When I got home I had guacamole (sort of) but NO CHIPS!  Reading the reviews I feel like I got gypped because NO ONE pointed out the free salsa and chip bar and it's not noticeable if you just place your to-go order at the counter.
.....

I contemplated going to the corner store when I learned I had no chips but I was simply TOO hungry to make that trek.  Besides, as I quickly learned, the guacamole was NOT really guacamole and more like salsa verde with a little sour cream in it.  It was good but IT WASN'T GUACAMOLE!
My fish taco plate was delicious and I have to say that this is the best Mexican outside of the Mission and that's sayin' a lot.
It still doesn't say more than a 3 star experience for me though.
author: Jill D.

description: Been eating here for years. Nice open and light. Luv the shitty telemundo shows. Bbq chicken burrito is our go to item.
author: Enzo L.

description:
I'm not hard to please when it comes to fast Mexican food. All you have to do is get at least one element right--flavor, horchada, atmosphere, price, whatever. I'm originally from Southern Arizona, the fast food Mexican capital of the world (kind of like the Mission), and I've subsisted on less than this. 

But El Shitty Burrito insists on making things difficult. They do weird, unnecessary things to your order, like charge you extra for lettuce and tomatoes but throw on heaps of sour cream and guac. The burritos and tacos are substandard, low in taste and low in quality (the greens perpetually appear wilted and taste vaguely of chlorine bleach). The horchada is either too watery or too chalky, with no inbetween. The fluorescent lighting is seizure-inducing and the interior is drab and dingy. When I was eating there I even tried to pick up a copy of The Onion from the display rack, but the stack of papers was trapped between the wall and the propped-open front door, so I couldn't even grab one. 

If I want cheap ass Mexican, I'll take the 49 to Mission. It's a shame I live 100 feet from it--every time I look out my window I am reminded of how much it sucks. Fuck this place.
author: Maxine Y.

description:
Most
disgusting
Mexican food
ever

And we were even kinda drunk... so what's that say?

I should have known when I sat down with my friend who had already ordered and gotten her food and thought "oh those chicken tacos look good" and then found out that they were actually fish tacos.

I should have known when I attacked the chips and salsa bar and found a plethora of soggy stale chips and nasty dried up salsa.

I should have known when, to go to the bathroom.. I had to go through the kitchen... around a corner... up the stairs.. and into a pitch dark room where I had to just sorta wing it and hope I was peeing into a toilet.

But no, I didn't really know until I ordered the chicken quesadilla and it came out with pink undercooked meat that (when mixed with the sour cream they slopped on there) looked like tuna salad. Tuna quesadilla anyone?

Another friend had a similar tuna looking quesadilla and another friend had chunks of hard, rock-like chicken in her burrito.

Disgusting.

I also find it funny that they haven't put their name back up on the front of the building... I bet I know why......
author: Derek B.

description: I like this spot.  I've never had a bad burrito here.  And I like how they always have  soccer in Spanish on the tv, very authentic.  Though I've moved from the area I still continue to patronize.
author: Joe M.

description:
Got a carnitas super burrito and some nachos. 

Burrito was good and meat tasted fresh. 

Nachos were good too.

Free chips and salsa but the pico de gallo is weak and the salsa verde literally tastes watered down. 

Service was fast and friendly and the location is great if your killin time before a show at the Regency center. 

All in all I guess I would be back if I was in the neighborhood. 

3 dollar coronas as well.
author: John Z.

description: Self-service chips and salsa were good, vegetarian burrito was solid.  Will def go back.
author: J. R.

description:
I know I should be eating whatever dish the restaurant is named for, but I'm all about good tacos. And buche. And tripas. Which is why I had the taco plate with one buche taco and one tripitas taco.

Maybe people who rate this place are looking for some Chipotle chain bling with some pretty menu pictures and fancy sounding names, but this place is not cruising with corporate mainstream. Think of it as a stationary taco truck (though definitely more expensive). They serve street tacos. Which is what I want. It's what I crave. And seriously, the stuff you get at Chipotle's, come on. She's got a sister named Taco Bell, who doesn't wear as much lipstick and eye-liner.

The buche was tasty, but a little bit fatty and the tripitas was really good. So if you are coming here for your chicken and cheese burrito, maybe it does suck and maybe that's because you are ordering gringo food.

The tables are rickety, the seemingly-ripped-from-a-gradeschool swing-arm seats suck serious ass and the salsa bar leaves something to be desired (though the pico de gallo is pretty tasty). Granted, the buche and tripitas tacos may not be the best I've ever had (Rico's wins, no question), but they were really good - especially the tripitas - and totally blow away the mediocre crap in my NoBe 'hood.

[edit] Oddly, I ate here the other day and it wasn't nearly as good as before. I tried the lengua and it was tough, unseasoned and gristly. The tripitas was deep fried so that it was crunchy like cracklin's and to add insult to injury, I felt nauseous after eating and ended up with my face in a toilet later. I think I'll be finding another taqueria... dammit.
author: Thomas S.

description: I had the most disgusting tacos here the other day! Honestly! I don't even think that they seasoned the meat, even the lettuce was gross, and they didn't even put salsa on it, there was a half slice of tomatoe on it tho which was annoying! I've had a couple burritos here like a year ago and don't remember them being revolting but these tacos were just gross! They took really long in comparison to busier, better taquerias! Complete amateurs!
author: Patricia H.

description:
This place is alright if you are in the area and want cheap Mexican.  The price of the Jumbo Burrito is $5.25 and the size of it is worthy of its name.  But the quality of the food as compared to a lot of other joints around SF is not great.  But you kind of have to expect that when you roll into a place called El Super Burrito.

Also if you are going to get the Quesadilla make sure you get the largest one as they basically punish you otherwise with this complete joke of a quesadilla.  My friend opted for the medium sized one and it was literally a third the size of the larger one.
author: Tom K.

description:
I don't like this place. It's cheap, and it has cool graphic paintings of Mexican foods above the counter, but it smells like urine, and I've found fishbones in my food before when I did not order fish.

I've also seen a homeless standing in the back, eating chips and salsa right out of the communal/complimentary snack area in the back, as if it were her very own plate - just chomping away, filling right up. 

I'd recommend avoiding this very dirty place, even though sometimes the food tastes "OK."
author: Heidi G.

description:
I tried a couple of burritos here only because, it'd be criminal not to, seeing how close this place is to Mi Casa. Overall, I was disappointed in the size, freshness of the ingredients, general taste and lack of extras like guacamole/avocado, not to mention, as a salsa verde fiend, the salsa bar looked like a tornado hit it. Sadly, not very appetizing.  The only good bit is that it is cheap. 

For a good burrito in the 'hood, Taqueria Express gets my vote.
author: I. O.

description:
Strong points: crispy carnitas. Ask for them extra crispy if you want. Really good. Slow carb burrito on a plate, no rice, no tortilla-- they hook it up with a ton of beans and make a nice little plate, no complaints.

Guac is a bit on the weak and runny side, and they always have sketchy people trying to fuck them over in various ways, stealing from the chips and salsa bar, begging for food in the restaurant, but I give them a lot of credit for handling those issues with decency and tact.
author: Anthony B.

description: There is a similar restaurant in my hometown of San Carlos and I absolutely love the food at both places!  The carnitas are fantastic and the tacos are not only filled with meat but delicious as well.
author: Kyl Q.

description: Kinda bummed....   To the Big Guy who took my order....   Mild means not too hot to eat!!!!!   If I ask multiple times for mild,  that probably means I want mild.   Next time pay less attention to your cell phone and gut the order straight, please.  Other than that,  we love the place.  However I promise you this, the next time I go in and don't see the female employee, who is awesome BTW, I am walking out.
author: Ajaib S.

description:
I like this place and will often stop by on my way to some watering hole or something in the hood.  

They have an adequate salsa area, all you can eat chips, and the food is good and comes fast.

There's always a table full of Mexican dudes near the chips drinking beer and laughing their asses off.  I always think they are talking and laughing about me!  They probably are.  Oh well, laugh away Amigos!!

Can't go wrong here, though what's up with the name?
author: King O.

description: Guys. Guys. My boyfriend and I usually eat burritos at el farolito.  We turn our noses up at taqueria Cancun. Tonight, we tried el super burrito for the first time and it was amazing. Not only is the carnivals juicy and crispy, the cheese is perfectly melted, the burritos are grilled... it was an amazing experience. I am so glad that we discovered this place. Really, try this place out. Super burrito with carnitas, you can't go wrong!
author: Ellen H.

description:
This place is straight up fucking garbage. The only time I eat here is when I'm desperate and don't have the energy to go to a place that make edible mexican food. They are the closest, I could roll down to cocina poblana or panchos but someone decided that this shit hole should exist. The carnitas are like eating burnt straw. The chicken is pretty shitty and it's damn hard to fuck that up. Then these motherfuckers can't even have a decent balance of temperature on their shit. You take a bite of their burritos and you never know what the fuck you're getting, hot maybe cold but usually just total crap. 

The only thing these motherfuckers have going for them is their medicore chile verde. I assume it's because not many order it so it doesn't sit out all day like their crap ass tubs of meat. I'm too scared to try the lengua because if you can't even get your beef half way decent I can only assume the tongue must taste like a bucket of dicks.

I have dreams of this place burning to the ground only to wake up and be disappointed. I'm fucking sick of being disappointed some one needs to get their arson game up.
author: Sergio O.

description:
I had a carne asada super burrito tonight.  I thought the meat was pretty good, and like at most taquerias it was enormous.  I couldn't taste or see any guacamole or avocado, which sucked, but the meat, beans, rice, sour cream and salsa were pretty good.  Napkins and Tapatio at every table is a nice plus, I hate having to get up and ask for those.  I didn't try the chips but will be sure to check them out next time.

I would give more stars if 1) there was guac/avocado in my super burrito, 2) the cheese was melted before adding the rest of the stuff and/or 3) if it was open later.

It didn't seem that dirty to me, and I thought the decor and loud Mexican music were appropriate.
author: Joseph N.

description: my co-worker grabs burritos here for us every other week or so for lunch. They are consistently good, i think the grilled chicken is quite nice, never dry. burritos are huge, definate bang for your buck. i definately recommend it, for a "california" sytle burrito, ie black beans, fresh avocado, green onions, etc. yum!
author: Kristi B.

description:
This place seems to get a bad rap... not sure why.  Their namesake "super burrito" is pretty tasty to me... I go for the carnitas without beans.  They grill their tortillas (rather than steam them), which is always a +1 star in my book.  The meat is tasty as is the rest of the fillings.

They lose a 1/2 star each for (a) really skimping on the guacamole, and (b) not having particularly great salsa.
author: David S.

description:
Meh.  Nothing special about this place.  I would never go back even though it's like a block from my house.  Not that it was horrible, because it wasn't, but I can't stand average Mexican food.  Other things I'd rather eat.

Just very unimpressed overall.  Seems to be the case with most of the Mexican food I've had since I've been here.  Being that I come from Southern California I am (apparently) extremely picky when it comes to Mexican food.  I can't seem to find anything that I actually am happy about eating.  I always think Mexican food is a good idea, but I've been nothing but disappointed at every location I try up here.  In socal good cheap Mexican food is a dime a dozen.  Come on San Francisco, it's not that hard.
author: Mary R.

description:
It is hard for me to rate this place because I come here, on average, 1-2 times a week. Not because of the stellar food or service, but because it is a hop, skip, and a jump from my apartment building.   The food is filling and fast and they don't give me the hairy eyeball when I come in the day after my friends and I acted like drunken idiots there the night before after too many drinks at the Heme.  "yeah, let's get change from the cashier so we can get some temporary tattoos and put them on each other's faces. ahahahahaa".  

The counter girl is a little slow on the uptake but has the patience of a saint and will, bless her, give you the change and not even give you crap about it.  

Notice I didn't say the food was good.  It is "meh" but it hits the spot when you are hungry or drunk or too lazy to cook and you need to eat right away.  Which, I usually am.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
I will never return to El Super Burrito. I called and ordered my food 15 minutes ahead of time for pickup. When I went to get it, it wasn't ready and i had to wait. So I figured, ok, I'll wait (thinking i'd be waiting maybe 5 min or so). Well, I ended up waiting 15 minutes when I finally asked whats up with my food...they told me its coming...so ok, I angrily waited 15 more min. when I told them I don't want it anymore my lunchtime was almost up...she then told me to wait five minutes...in five minutes my burrito was ready...
This could be forgivable if it only happened once. But months later I broke my vow to never eat there again and ate there and the exact thing happened again...on my way out the door, I told the lady working there,  I'll never eat here again, and she said,...OK...haha. No more, no thanks. The food is so-so, so I haven't felt I've been missing out or anything.
author: Maya L.

description: After some time abroad in overseaslandia I had a hankering for some real Mexican so I went to this place. This is the real shite. If you want some mango chutney salsa seaweed kale elixircleanser vegan burritos, piss off back to yuppielandia. El Super Burrito is where you can have a massive plate of real food with and amazing view and a smiley, no bullshit service. Viva el Super Burrito cabrones.
author: Jean-Guillaume L.

description:
Ill break it down simple, 

Positives:
-Clean
-Salsa bar with free chips
-About a dollar cheaper than most other burritos

Negatives:
-It is probably the worst burrito ive had in SF, the pollo is extremely undercooked - like wet pink chicken ...-are you f****'n kidding me? your charging money for that?
Also the rice and beans taste like cardboard paste.
I dont know how they put so many different flavorful ingredients into this thing and still have it come out tasting bland and crappy.

The Alpastor was OK though.
Still super bland, undercooked meat and the staff seem like they are 'tolerating' anyone who isnt latino rather than treating them like any other customer.

Go to Chunky's - they may not be friendly but their burritos are irresponsibly good. El Tesoro is good too jsut go to the one thats attached to the market on Geary not the other one.
author: Val M.

description: I've gone here a few times only because I work nearby.  Underwhelming.  My last order (chicken torta) will be my last order here.
author: Michael R.

description:
Lord, El Super Burrito is on yelp?

I lived around the corner and let me tell you this:  stick to a rice and beans burrito if you must eat here.

Granted, you can get a chicken taco plate for under $4 but don't do it.  And, don't  get the salsa (it's been sitting uncovered for who knows how long) at the salsa bar.

But, if you are broke, a tranny hooker on her lunch break, drunk, or just really in the mood for bottom of the barrel mexican food...El Super Burrito will do just fine.
author: Diego S.

description: Pretty good burrito, which is all I've had here. Doesn't compare to the Mission, but this is only three blocks from me and that makes it great. I'll be back many times.
author: Wes K.

description:
I've come here a few times always with mixed results. Nothing has ever been really awful but the true test (the genesis of this review if you will) came this last weekend. I brought three drunk crazy Mexican chicks from Eastside San Jose up for Pink Saturday. If there were ever three "qualified" judges for a taqueria, this would be them.

Lengua tacos, a carnitas super burrito, vegetarian tacos, plus plenty of chips and salsa were quickly delivered to our tables and consumed by all. The only thing that slowed the pace of our consumption was the occasional burly pepper that would leave a trail of burn down the throat/ out the nose. Two of the ladies found the jukebox by the salsa bar and went to town finding some banda to sing and dance with. The staff though cordial, seemed a little freaked out by our bailadoras. C'mon guys, this is Polk Street. You crazier stuff than this every night.
author: Veronica G.

description:
Ok first of all if you like your burritos to contain black beans, steamed veggies, "fresh" ingredients, or salmon, then you just aren't going to enjoy this place, or any burrito place that I recommend.

I have been having a tuff time finding burritos I really like, because the burritos up here are a bit different from the ones you get in San Diego. Not saying the ones here are bad, just not to my liking. I have lived by El Super Burrito for 2 years and never went in because the outside of it looks so damn depressing. But today I finally went in and I am kicking myself....

First of all, the inside is nothing at all like the outside. It is bright and there is ranchero playing on a big juke and lots of people inside. 

Second of all, I got a carne asada burrito that I really liked. I agree with some yelpers that the carne was a bit dry, but I appreciated the consistency of the burrito. Granted I don't think rice belongs in a burrito, but still the whole thing was easy to eat and really delicious to me. 

There are some negatives. Their hot carrots blow. The horchata is good but not great. My friend's veggie burrito was a little soggy. But who gets a veggie burrito anyway? Whatever.

So I will definitely be back there. I guess you'll either love the style or hate it. So far it's my fave in the city.
author: Andrea S.

description: I absolutely loooove the carnitas super burrito! Great place to go when you are just craving some Mexican food.
author: Emily C.

description: The food reminds me of an episode of "kitchen nightmares!"
author: Chizzy T.

description:
I've only been here once and my meal was the only time I've ever had a San Franciscan burrito, so I don't have a whole lot to go off of, but I wasn't incredibly impressed. All-in-all it was a decent super carnitas burrito, and cheap! I definitely would have asked them to hold the sour cream if I knew that was part of the deal. 

I took my burrito to go, which was fine because the dining area didn't do much to increase my appetite.
author: Jessica M.

description:
My burrito tasted so good I was actually raving, but I think it's because the carne asada was really fatty and tasted sort of like carnitas (and as a Jew, I love carnitas) but within the hour I felt sick from the grease. The burrito cost $5.50, which is cheaper than most of the places near my house.

I came here because it was the only taqueria I could see from the Hemlock, and I suppose I'll probably come back next time I can see it. But I probably wouldn't suggest it to a friend.
author: Amy Z.

description: Ive gone to this place about 4 times. They are known for their cheap oregon burritos which has french fries in it. I guess you get what you pay for. My buddy and I bought oregon burritos last night and now are paying the price. The steak was bad and our stomachs are hurting pretty badly; diarhea, etc. God dammit because I love this place, but I will never be back.
author: Chris L.

description: In my own humble little opinion I think this is one the City's best burritos.  What makes it so rad?  Well when I ate meat the carnitas was the perfect mix of salty spicy pork yumminess and when I stopped the veggie one was almost as amazing.  The salsa bar has everything you'll ever need without over doing it. The only thing that keeps this place from getting 5 stars is the that it can be a little dirty sometimes and the random crackheads or tranny that pops in.  Get it to go.
author: Sharon L.

description:
ha! ok so either i should've just gotten a burrito or this place really isnt that great. I ordered a chicken taco plate and  the girl was like do you want bbq chicken and i was like no just regular taco chicken and it was like canned tuna status.  I know canned chicken when i see it and this was cold canned chicken.  Its a good thing i ordered the plate with rice and bean b/c i wouldn't have eaten if i didnt. 
On the up side the burrito my friend ordered lookd really good and the free chips and salsa are a huge plus
you're better off stopping in and getting free chips and then going home and making your own tacos lol
author: Sloane G.

description:
Woe is me in a world where El Super Burrito garners only two point five Yelper stars.  Personally I think they wrap up the finest loaf in the hood.  And among the least expensive.  They'll role you up a fat one with all the goodies for under six bucks, compared to up to eight+ in the Tenderloin.  Times just aren't what they used to be.  Inflation happens to be hitting the burrito industry especially hard here in 07.  Ben Bernanke, where you at?

Might I make a recommendation.   Get the BBQ chicken burrito with whatever you like on it, hit up the free chips and salsa bar, load up on the pickled carrots from the jalapeno trough, and pucker up for some burrito joy.  Other things I might recommend; their torta, delicious; nachos, splendiferous; tacos, ay ay ay.
author: Jeff B.

description: I eat here for lunch; which they let me call in, never pay over 10$ for a complete meal, and have yet to be disappointed. They get the 4th star for consistency.
author: Rob C.

description:
$5.50 for a pretty big burrito with a good amount of carne asada

The free chips and salsa is a nice touch, and the guy making the food was very pleasant and friendly. Not the best, but good for a quick meal if you're passing by and/or strapped for cash
author: VL K.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for a few years and stop by here every so often for a burrito. It's the only cheap burrito place in this neighborhood (Nick's Crispy Taco's doesn't really count, since they have funky hours and are slightly more pricey... but, so good...).

Anyway, not too many complaints. They have good salsa, their burritos are tasty (admittedly, I've never eaten here after going to bars. That usually involves pizza, even when I'm in the Mission), and their small TV in a corner of the room blasting your ears with Univision just adds to the ambiance.

It is kind of dark. I think only half of their lights work. And the music can be somewhat obnoxious.

But when it comes right down to it, it's a cheap and tasty burrito that can be acquired without having to deal with hipster crowds.
author: Dave S.

description: THE BURRITO IS BIG. pico de gallo yummy. close to home, but it's not the most amazing....
author: Nicole H.

description: My chicken burrito was OK. Kinda bland, the chicken was basically just  dark meat...no seasoning or anything. The price was right for a huge filling meal ($6). I would definitely go back to try something else!
author: Annie D.

description: I dont think this place will knock any body's sox off but it will certainly suffice. I e at at this place all of the time. and I theroughly enjoy it, but I feel that it is a little on the low quality food side. however with their semi low quality ingredients the make a delicious burrito.
author: Zak L.

description: Got a super burrito here and it was big, but not the greatest. The whole restaurant was pretty messy/dirty and the chips were stale. Next time I will most likely just go to the subway across the street.
author: Chris G.

description: My favorite burrito place in the City. Hands down. There are always a ton of Latinos eating here, what more do you want for a ringing endorsement. The food is always good and they have cheap beer. The service is quick and friendly.What's not to like?
author: Ryan R.

description: Subpar in terms of the amazingly good burritos that are available around here.  I guess most people don't notice since it's a regular post-drinking-binge spot, but not what I prefer.
author: Mason G.

description: I love this place, we know the staff at this point and they start making my order as i walk in the door. Burritos taste awesome, free unlimited chips with salsa and good price. I love it here
author: Kalen F.

description: The burritos are so bad, the ingredients can get out of the tortilla and walk on their own. These burritos are so cheap, they leap. The salsa/chip bar has more germs than a nappy ass perm.
author: Braden B.

description: Most of my colleagues, friends, and acquaintances had told me to stay away from this place at any cost. Went in there a couple days ago with some friends for some hangover nourishment. I was pleasantly surprised; surprised only because I had heard it was terrible. I got the Carnitas Super Burrito. The carnitas were super tasty. The burrito itself was nothing to write home about. it was an average burrito, so therefore I give this place an average rating. If you're in the area and you need a solid burrito, I'd say go to Olivo's.
author: Mike B.

description: I keep on seeing negative reviews for this place...are these people expecting baja fresh or something?   For the neighborhood, it can't be beat.  We call it El Stupor Burrito, as after eating a $5.50 super you're not going be doing much for a couple hours.
author: Chris C.

description: This restaurant is a little grungy-looking, but definitely has an authentic vibe to their food. It was a little more expensive than I expected it to be, but nothing that comes remotely close to breaking the bank. Actually, they should change their name to El Super Taco Salad, because mine was really yummy.
author: Gregor G.

description: I don't know my ass from my elbow when it comes to SF, but this place came highly recommended based on my love for burritos. Based on some of the (strongly) negative reviews, the rec may have been a prank, but I was satisfied nonetheless. The Jumbo Wet Al Pastor Burrito was tasty, filling, and more than enough to sop up my residual hangover from the night before. The meat was excellent; the rest was okay but lacked any nuance. (It feels pretentious to use the word "nuance" in reviewing a cheap burrito joint, but f*ck it, I'm a burrito snob.) If the salsa were less watery, and the interior a little less dingy, ESB could be El Cuatro Estrella Burrito.
author: Trevor R.

description: This place is great. I've always had great service and it's nice that they have free chips to munch on while waiting for your food.
author: Ryan H.

description: My bf ordered an chicken burrito and it contained some pork in it! Bad! Just terrible. That shows that they just don't care.
author: E W.

description: I am in total SHOCK. how is this only rated a 2.5 star???? there must be something wrong with my palate. I LOVE this place. Maybe I'm just lucky. Maybe every time I order a steak queso it's the greatest steak queso that that Mexican has ever made, or maybe...just maybe, I'm too drunk to realize I'm eating a dead homeless man's innards. The burritos are also great.
author: Boyd W.

description:
best pico de gallo ever!  o tenderlion, such secrets you keep.  who knew you could grab awesome nachoes and a she/he hooker all in 1 block!  So cheesey the nachoes and goodness. o goodness.

come here for some finger lickin nachoes, if you want hookers that's cool too!
author: Chrammy D.

description: This place isn't so bad. I don't know what's up w/ all the 1 star reviews, but maybe it depends on the time of day. I dropped in just around 12 noon, and I ordered the "Kid's Burrito" which just comes w/ beans and cheese. I added rice and guacamole and specified "no cilantro". Sadly, the guacamole had cilantro in it, but I was able to open the burrito and eat the non-cilantrified portions with a fork. All in all, it was a very decent  3 star burrito. Also cheap - $3.75 and then an additional $1 for the guac and rice for a total of $4.75. They have a salsa and chips bar, so you can help yourself. I probably won't go out of my way to go back, but if I'm ever walking by and/or dead drunk, I'd probably go there.
author: Maren P.

description: My first Burrito experience in SF and definitely wasn't disappointed.  UNLIMITED free chips & salsa do not exist at any other taqueria.  They also carry California Burritos now!
author: AJ B.

description:
The positives aspects of this place are actually fairly decent;  

*  the service is phenomenal!  The people are extremely nice!
*  the portions are HUGE
*  the prices are GREAT

As for a taqueria, only one negative aspect, that, unfortunately is fairly important - the food is only average.

It's a shame the food isn't better.....with great service, prices & huge portions & only average food I still go there once & a while.  I'd be there all the time if the food were better.

If you want a Taqueria with great service, low prices and huge portions then you could do much worse than El Super Burrito.
author: The P.

description: Pretty decent Burrito joint.  Not one of my very favorites but if I was in the area and craving a burrito, I'd certainly would come back.  So it'd be a matter of convenience...  and I have been back a few times...
author: Mark W.

description: Huge burrito for cheap price. And never got ill from eating there. Not gourmet, but it will do.
author: Jeff L.

description: My ex loved this place, and he finally convinced me one day to try their burrito. I was horrified. The chicken was watery (it was sitting in a metal tray with water..... whats up with that? and it was supposed to  be grilled chicken) and the horchata lacked flavor. to top it off we we paid a friendly visit from a 2" long cockroach. needless to say i stopped eating and ran out of there. just a wonder they have been around so long.
author: Marina K.

description: Stopped by early evening, hungry on Polk st, while visiting. I was looking for something affordable, there were a lot of people already inside, so it seemed like a good sign. I ordered 2 fis taco plate special. Chips and salsa were decent, beer $3 import. Meal size was large, and I was surprised on how could it was. Evereything tasted clean,fresh.
author: KELLEY C.

description:
Don't go here if it's just because you're close. Go to El Tesoro at Ofarrel and Leavenworth. 4 minute walk away and isn't crap. El Tesoro is actually the best Mexican food I've had in SF except for the taco truck near Best Buy on Harrison Street. I use yelp but never wrote a review before. This place disgusted me so bad on my last visit that I decided to open a Yelp account in order to warn people about this place.

El Super Burrito place used to be good but fell off the map. I went in the other day and instead of the adults working there was a child behind the counter. She took at least 3 minutes to take my order and ring me up for 2 tacos. She was watching Hannah Montana while a cook and 2 other adult employees stood there doing nothing. I finally got my tacos and found myself spending more time picking chicken bones out of the first taco than I did eating it. Thinking it may have been a single bad taco I started eating the other one and had more chicken bones ranging from a quarter inch to almost 1 inch.

Don't go hear. Go to El Tesoro on Offarrel and Leavenworth. Worth the extra few minutes of walking to skip El Crappy Burrito

I understand if you can't get a babysitter that worst case scenario you may have to bring your kid to work, but DON'T bring them to work to make them f*cking work. BS!
author: g m.

description: I had a great carne asada burrito here last week when I was absolutely starving.  I'm not sure if it was good because I was hungry or simply wasn't paying attention.  I came back 2 days later & ordered the same burrito & the meat was overcooked & dry & tasteless.  The chips made up for it but it was still a letdown.  Sigh, just when Polk St. was becoming my new fave neighborhood for eating....:(
author: Patricia M.

description: Meat galore in this SD style burrito.  Too much galore in fact.  When I've been here in the past for an SF style burrito, I've been generally unimpressed.  Given that I didn't taste anything else on account of all the meat, I am similarly unimpressed with their SD style burrito.  Not for nothing, but the ton of carne asada was way better than I expected it to be.  If only this exercise was about discovering the best meat burrito...but it's not, it's about discovering the best SD style burrito.
author: Paul M.

description: I am really surprised by the overall reviews. I have lived by this place for quite a while now and finally decided to try this place out. I really liked the burrito. It hought it was pretty tasty. I didn't like the chips too much though. I do like the prices and I will definitely come back.
author: Nir B.

description: With a name so exciting and an interior so very "please come in here and have some Coronas at an inappropriate time of day," you really know how to screw up a first, second and third impression.  Your chips are stale.  Your chicken has something funky going on in it.  Your beans are doing something weird.  The salsa inside the two burritos I got on two separate occasions went bad over night in my refrigerator.  Do you know how much I love to eat the second half of my burrito the next day, El Super Burrito?  Do you?!  If you were soooo super, then you would.
author: Nicole A.

description: Wow, I am suprised to see this place get such a low review.  I think it is the best burrito spot in the area (nob hill, tenderloin, upper nob hill)  The burrito's are HUGE, many selections.  The cooks and cashier's are quick, consistant, and friendly.  The burrito's are not expensive either.  I've had their entrees here also, and they are great.  I love super burrito, reccommend it to everybody I know
author: Brandon E.

description: The burritos - Al pastor, carnitas, bbq chicken, veggie - are good, and large enough to save half for later. The decor isn't classy, but this is a fine spot for lunch. When the room is full of Mexican's on their lunch break, the tv is on telemundo, AND the juke box is ripping out some kinda carnival song, you know the food can't be all bad. The counter staff are always friendly.
author: Gus J.

description: I don't understand why this place only has 2.5 stars ?!?!?! It's soooo good. Cheap food and all you can eat chips and salsa (which is amazing pico de gallo!). It's definitely a solid taqueria, and probably my favorite one here in SF.
author: brendan g.

description: After the homeless bum bagged a bunch of tortilla chips and salsa, I didn't want to return to get more of the pico de gallo.  Oh well, it wasn't that fresh anyway.  I really like my al pastor taco, but a little too greasy, but great corn tortillas.  Too bad this place is in a dirty location, because they are slacking on the interior too.  It would be such a better place if they just cleaned it up.
author: Julie R.

description: While certainly not the worst health inspection record I've ever seen, the place is pretty dirty.  The food is fairly satisfying though, so it surprises me that they have let the place come into such disrepair.   Overall, the restaurant is great if your just looking for a quick bite in the area, yet not somewhere you would take somebody out for a nice sit down dinner.   I enjoy the size of the portions and even though they are sometimes a little slow, the free chips and salsa should hold you off for a bit.  The ingredients may not be the best quality as a few times I have visited the carne asada had quite a bit of toughness and gristle in it.   I would say El Super Burrito is a must to visit in the area at least once.
author: Paige C.

description: Best close burrito.  reasonable prices, friendly atmosphere.  their salsas are one of their high points.
author: Todd N.

description: Average Mexican joint. Nothing outstanding BUT they do have unlimited chips and salsa which al lot of taquerias are lacking these days. Extra star for that.
author: Tommy P.

description:
best burritos outside of the mission.

and better than many in the mission too.

in fact, its as good as anything that i remember from growing up in the self-proclaimed "mexican food capital of the world", el paso (texas)! and thats saying something!

good tacos, enchiladas, and most everything else on the menu...

plus, its close to home. what more could i ask for???

we eat here at least every week.

thanks, el super burrito!
author: kyle y.

description: One of the best values for Mexcian in town.  $3.25 for a crispy taco loaded w/ sour cream, cheese, guacamole, and sour creme + rice + refritos with a free chip and salsa bar.  You can't beat that with a stick.  The pico de gallo on the salsa bar is wonderfully fresh and light, you can literally eat it like a salad.  El Super's best meat has to be their carnitas;  they fry them up a little extra before serving to crsip them. The burritos are so huge I can eat half for lunch and half for dinner.  And finally, MENUDO AND BIRRIA ON THE WEEKENDS!!!  This place rocks.
author: matthew w.

description:
meh, I came here for lunch, and also once late night when I was drunk...and both times left something to be desired....like, I dunno, quality...The beef burrito I got was all fatty/gristly...ick. 

Salsa was good.
author: Matthew S.

description: Thank god this place is my local taqueria. I love the burritos! Either after the gym or the day after a long night at the lush lounge, this place is awesome. I especially like the panoramic view of SF from like 1950 for sale on the wall, the blare of Univision and of course, the food and genial service. If only they delivered....
author: Timoteo K.

description: Lived it and loved it.  Got a carne asada super burrito with the works!  It was delicious.  Also gotta love the free chips and salsa, as well as the digital jukebox.
author: Karl B.

description: In the three years I've lived in San Francisco, I've done a tour de force of all the burrito spots, and El Super is one of my favorites. If you want authentic Mexican (not just burritos) then this is your spot. The decor seems to be throwing a lot of people off, with some people calling it dirty. This isn't the case, it's just run down a bit - and that adds to its charm if you ask me.
author: Jay F.

description:
Alright, I know a lot of people are down on the El Super Burrito, but can I just say this is some of the most authentic and delicious mexcan food I've had? Granted I'm from NY and we don't have great mexican, this place is one of the first ones that I tried and it's still a favorite. The place is a little dirty, but c'mon thats where the flavor comes from! The free chips are awesome too. 

My usual fare is a giant quesadilla with carne asada and a large pineapple drink. All awesome, all the time. 

The fajitas are great too if you're looking to spend some extra cash on it.
author: John K.

description:
I don't get it.  Is this place part of the El Burrito mini-chain, featured on Taraval and Divisadero streets? The taste makes me think no. While both El Burrito Express stores deliver consistently good burritos in places without them, this place just delivers burritos. 

About 2 years ago, I was in a desperate burrito fix and happened to drive by this place.  I entered, starving and easy to please.  From there, everything went downhill.  My order took forever even though I was the only one in there.  The burrito was bland and watery. The salsa sucked -- hell, the salsa bar was filthy and I'm no salsa bar snob.

The bathroom is downright frightening. It's up some dark stairs, not exactly where you want to go on this downtrodden part of Polk Street.
author: Dean A.

description: Bean and Cheese is GREAT!!!  Free chips too.  This is my type of place... affordable and delicious.
author: Michael A.

description: This place is pretty shitty.  It is really cheap, but I probably won't be back.  Go up the street a little bit and hit panchos if you want a burrito close by.
author: Daniel R.

description: I have not a clue as to what's going on here. Call me crazy but El Super Burrito has the best carnitas I've ever tried and the salsa is the best in town; it usually has just the right amount of fresh jalapeno. They do skimp out on the "heat lamp" over their chips so I knocked off a star and I haven't tired anything by the burritos and tortas but I do recommend this place.
author: jordan t.

description: While some Mexican food restaurants have fancy and romantic names like El Farrolito or Taqueria Cancun, the people at El Super Burrito said, "Fuck that!  Let's have our name tell people exactly what we do; we make big motherfucking burritos.  That's what we do!"  It'd be like a clothing store being named Very Comfortable Cotton T-shirts (believe it or not, one of the world's biggest telescopes is actually called the Very Large Telescope.  These people can design a way to see light years away, yet can't think of anything better than Very Large Telescope.).  Despite the uncreative name though, the burritos here are good and yes, very big.  The jumbo burrito is easily big enough for two people to split and it's only $5.50.  They also have all you can eat chips and salsa.  But the decoration here takes the cake; they have so many Corona streamers and piatas hung up that you would think it was a five year old kid named Corona's birthday party.
author: Broke-Ass Stuart S.

description: this place is like right next to a bar, so u get to see all kind of wierd people here every friday night... but besides that the place seems to be under control. it would be better if they fix the seats.. they have a couple of old tables and chair it the back.. the food is GOOD! i love their carnitas! and their enchilladas!
author: Silvia C.

description: the second star is ONLY b/c of this joint's GREAT name! any burrito that's not jam packed and wrapped painfully tightly, not so good by me. the salsa and chip bar may be on the next episode of fear factor. i know its mean of me, but...
author: Hae-Jin K.

description: burritos......check, enchiladas....check, quesadillas...check.  flavorful mexican food in generous portions! good both before and/or after a lengthy bar crawl. el super burrito es muy bueno!
author: eric g.

description: The name is overly complimentary, but I can understand why the owner doesn't call it "El So-So Burrito".  I'd go back, but probably not very often, and I certainly wouldn't go out of my way.  I doubt this place would last too long in the Mission, but fortunately for the owner, there's not much burrito competition around Polk & Sutter.  The quality of steak seems a little below average, and the burritos have too much rice relative to meat.
author: Luke P.

description: the best part is when my mind went blank when i arrived at the register "....duh duh WHAT KIND OF BEANS DO YOU HAVE?" the cabron behind it goes, reluctantly "pinto, refried, black...." "refried!" realizing this isnt whole foods, you know that frijoles construction consisted of Lard, so i change my order " I apologize, conquistador, but i would prefer the black, por favor (didnt really say it like that). he gets all flustered, and throws away the old ticket, and rewrites one out. i ask for the black, cilantro, rice and avocado (there is no set menu item for this), and thats what i got. the dinkiest burro this side of the mish, bro. the trEEEEZ stars take into consideration its the only burrito place by work, and the taste was actually pretty majestic, but i aint hard to please when it comes to salsa, beans and rice. MUY MEDIOCRE!
author: Christopher J.

description: i always order the super burrito with Carne Asada, black beans, extra guacamole, they are so nice there, you can get a large cup of ice for free, free chips and salsa...the burrito is gigantic and the service is so fast you never have to wait long at all...
author: Laimei W.

description:
this place is around the corner from me and good enough to warrant me returning after the first visit. the taco plate is a good deal at under $4 for a taco with rice and beans. add the chips and salsa bar and you've got a substantial cheap meal. 

and yes, all you've read about the skeeviness is true. do not attempt to visit the bathroom whatever you do, if you think the salsa bar is bad. 

it's dirty but its decent. there's not much else decent mexican around that i know of.
author: Saikat P.

description: Cheap food, good flavor, portions are generous.  Don't expect "chipotle" or "qdoba" atmosphere, this place is traditional and not dirty, but not bright and cheerful like the chain restaurants mentioned above.  But for under $10 before tip, I had a super burrito, a miller light, and was full, and in and out in under 20 minutes.  Good food, good price, I definately recomend.
author: Nick F.

description: el super burrito. It has the best location and the staff is very friendly and has gotten to know me and the boyfriend. There are three burrito places in walking distance of el super burrito and we pick this one every time. the burritos are inexpensive (unlike poncho villa and the yuppie/ snobie douches seam to prefer poncho crapo just because their is a line) and big. i always get a chicken or chile rellano super burrito add guac and love it. i personally do not like the chips but my boyfriend can't seem to get enough. i also like the booth setting.
author: Rhonda Y.

description: I really did not enjoy the vegetarian tacos I had there.  Granted, I just asked for rice, whole beans, salsa and lettuce, but they were pretty flavorless.  And soggy from the watery lettuce.  Only giving it two stars because my friends liked the fish tacos.  Would not go back if I could help it--the place seemed pretty dirty.
author: Kim W.

description: cheap, easy, and a bit dirty inside.  when i need a burrito, and im not in the mission, ill jam out to some mariachi rock and woof down here.
author: Olis L.

description: Cheap, quick and good. Al pastor probably isn't authentic, but it's good.
author: Michael T.

description: This place is bomb. I prefer the regular burrito over the super burro... it's just a better burrito. Bathrooms are gross but whatever... you're there for the food not the amenities......
author: Dave H.

description: Okay, you have to venture into lower Polk for this burrito, but come on it is not a big deal. Okay their may be a drunk guy or a transient outside (or inside eating a taco), but roll with it.  They have a great salsa and the burrito is great and cheap!  I hate paying eight bucks for a tiny burrito, wouldn't you rather get an El Super burrito that you can barely finish? And for five bucks! So stop by and get a burrito to-go. The Stars are for the burrito not the location!
author: Niko P.

description: i don't think people are really getting it. even though it is called super burrito that's just to attract gringos. this place is a taqueria and a damn fine taqueria in the Polk gulch if you ask me. i think that most people would be pleasantly surprised if they tried other things on the menu. I usually opt for the tacos al pastor, they are very tasty. This place is also frequented by a lot of Mexican clientele and since they probably know Mexican food better than you or I do that should tell you something. That being said I have never as of yet seen a Mexican patron order a burrito here. Come to think of it I very rarely see anyone other than white folks order burritos at any taqueria. I used to eat here 1-2 times a week because it was in close proximity to my old apt. now having moved to SOMA it is definitely a place that will be missed. i think it is actually one of the best taquerias outside of the mission.
author: Anthony Y.
